phase1.name: Phase 1: Tier 4 Content
phase1.description: The first raiding tier of The Burning Crusade. Introduces players to 10-man and 25-man raid content. Most guilds start with Karazhan to gear up before attempting the 25-man raids.

karazhan.name: Karazhan
attunementSteps: 1. Pick up quest from Archmage Alturus outside Karazhan entrance
2. Complete Shadow Labyrinth (final boss drops First Key Fragment)
3. Complete Steamvault (final boss drops Second Key Fragment)
4. Complete Arcatraz (final boss drops Third Key Fragment)
5. Return to Archmage Alturus to receive The Master's Key
karazhan.description: The haunted tower of the Last Guardian, Medivh. This iconic 10-player raid is the entry point for most guilds and features diverse boss mechanics across multiple wings. Expect to spend 3-4 hours on early clears, eventually getting down to 2 hours with gear.

recommendedComposition.notes: Bring at least one Mage or Druid for decursing. A Priest is highly valuable for Shackle Undead on Moroes. Having a Warlock makes several fights easier.

minimumGear.dps: Pre-raid Best in Slot gear from heroic dungeons recommended

karazhan.tierTokens: Tier 4 Gloves and Helm tokens drop from Curator and Prince Malchezaar

bosses.name: Attumen the Huntsman
bosses.description: The ghostly huntsman of Karazhan, accompanied by his spectral steed Midnight. This is the first boss most groups will encounter. The fight has three phases based on Midnight's health percentage.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (100% to 95% Midnight HP): Only Midnight is active. Tank and damage Midnight.
Phase 2 (95% to 25% Midnight HP): Attumen spawns and must be picked up by a second tank. Both must be tanked facing away from the raid.
Phase 3 (25% Midnight HP): Attumen mounts Midnight, combining into a single target. Single tank needed, burn the boss down.

abilities.name: Shadow Cleave
abilities.description: A frontal cone attack dealing approximately 4,000 shadow damage to anyone in front of the boss.
abilities.handling: The tank must always face Midnight and Attumen away from the raid. Melee damage dealers should position themselves behind the boss at all times. Never stand in front of either target.

abilities.name: Intangible Presence
abilities.description: A curse applied to random players that reduces their chance to hit by 50% for 15 seconds. This severely cripples damage output and can cause the tank to lose threat.
abilities.handling: Mages and Druids must remove this curse immediately. Priority order: Tank first, then melee damage dealers, then ranged/casters. A cursed tank can lose aggro and cause a wipe.

abilities.name: Charge
abilities.description: After merging in Phase 3, the mounted Attumen will charge random raid members, dealing approximately 2,000 damage and knocking them back.
abilities.handling: Ranged players and healers should spread out loosely, staying at least 20 yards from the boss. Avoid standing near edges or ledges where knockback could be fatal.

bosses.strategy: Phase 1: Your main tank grabs Midnight and faces it away from the group. All damage dealers attack Midnight until it reaches 95% health. Phase 2: When Attumen spawns, your off-tank (second tank) must immediately pick him up with a taunt. Keep both targets faced away from the raid. Focus damage on Attumen until Midnight reaches 25% health. Phase 3: The two merge into a mounted form. Your main tank takes over while the off-tank can switch to damage. Remove curses constantly and burn the boss down. Use consumables like health potions if your group is undergeared.
commonMistakes: Standing in front of either target and getting cleaved
Not decursing the tank, causing them to miss attacks and lose threat
Tank getting knocked off the platform by Charge in Phase 3

bosses.name: Moroes
bosses.description: The undead steward of Karazhan. Moroes is a rogue-type boss accompanied by four randomly selected dinner guests. This fight tests your raid's ability to use crowd control effectively while managing a deadly bleed debuff.
guestList: Baroness Dorothea Millstipe - Shadow Priest (can Mind Flay, dangerous)
Baron Rafe Dreuger - Retribution Paladin (moderate threat)
Lady Catriona Von'Indi - Holy Priest (will heal, top priority kill)
Lady Keira Berrybuck - Holy Paladin (will heal and cleanse)
Lord Robin Daris - Arms Warrior (Mortal Strike, moderate threat)
Lord Crispin Ference - Protection Warrior (low priority, can be left for last)

abilities.name: Garrote
abilities.description: After vanishing, Moroes applies this deadly bleed to a random player. It deals 1,000 damage every 3 seconds for FIVE MINUTES and cannot be dispelled by normal means. Total damage: over 100,000 if not removed.
abilities.handling: Only specific abilities can remove Garrote: Dwarf Stoneform racial, Paladin Blessing of Protection, Mage Ice Block, and Paladin Divine Shield. Save these abilities for when Garrote lands on a healer. If none of these counters are available, healers must simply heal through the damage - assign one healer per Garrote target if multiple people are affected.

abilities.name: Gouge
abilities.description: Moroes gouges his current target, stunning them for 6 seconds. He then attacks whoever is second on his threat list.
abilities.handling: You MUST have two tanks for this fight. When the main tank gets gouged, the off-tank must immediately taunt Moroes. If there is no off-tank ready, Moroes will likely run to a healer and kill them instantly. Communicate when Gouge is coming.

abilities.name: Blind
abilities.description: A poison effect that disorients a nearby player for 10 seconds.
abilities.handling: Can be dispelled with Abolish Poison or Paladin Cleanse. Lower priority than other mechanics, but annoying if it hits a healer during a critical moment.

abilities.name: Vanish
abilities.description: Moroes vanishes into the shadows, becomes untargetable, and then applies Garrote to a random raid member before returning to attack the highest threat target.
abilities.handling: This cannot be prevented. It occurs roughly every 30 seconds. When Moroes vanishes, prepare to heal whoever gets Garrote. The tank should be ready to pick him back up when he reappears.

bosses.strategy: Before pulling, assign crowd control to the guests. Priests should Shackle Undead the Holy Priest and Shadow Priest guests. Mages can Polymorph the Paladin guests. Hunters can Freezing Trap warriors. Kill order: Holy Priest (Lady Catriona) first to stop healing, then Shadow Priest (Baroness Dorothea), then Holy Paladin (Lady Keira), then Retribution Paladin (Baron Rafe), then Warriors, and finally Moroes himself. Keep two tanks on Moroes at all times trading threat. Save Blessing of Protection, Stoneform, Ice Block, and Divine Shield for when Garrote lands on healers. After all guests are dead, it becomes a tank-and-spank while healing through Garrote damage.
commonMistakes: Not having crowd control break and adds running loose
Only having one tank and losing players to Gouge
Wasting Garrote removal abilities early instead of saving them for healers
Killing guests in the wrong order and letting healers prolong the fight

bosses.name: Maiden of Virtue
bosses.description: A holy construct found in the Guest Chambers. This fight punishes melee with constant holy damage and periodically stuns the entire raid. Positioning and dispelling are critical.

abilities.name: Repentance
abilities.description: Every 25-35 seconds, Maiden incapacitates the ENTIRE RAID for 12 seconds. During this time, no one can act, cast, or heal.
abilities.handling: Paladin Blessing of Sacrifice on a healer will break them out instantly when Maiden's aura damages them. Warrior Berserker Rage makes you immune. PvP trinkets and Undead Will of the Forsaken also work. Before Repentance, healers should apply heal-over-time effects on the raid. Having at least one person break out early to heal is critical.

abilities.name: Holy Fire
abilities.description: A damage-over-time effect on a random target dealing approximately 3,000 holy damage over 12 seconds.
abilities.handling: DISPEL THIS IMMEDIATELY - it is your top priority. Assign two players to dispel duty (Priests and Paladins). Multiple people can have this at once, so dispellers need to be vigilant.

abilities.name: Holy Ground
abilities.description: A consecration aura around Maiden dealing approximately 300 holy damage per second to anyone within 12 yards. It also silences spellcasting.
abilities.handling: Melee damage dealers must accept this damage - healers need to compensate with extra healing. Melee should NOT try to cast instant heals while in range due to the silence. This is unavoidable for melee.

abilities.name: Holy Wrath
abilities.description: Chain holy damage that jumps between nearby players. The damage DOUBLES with each jump: 500 to first target, 1,000 to second, 2,000 to third, 4,000 to fourth, and so on.
abilities.handling: SPREAD OUT at least 10 yards apart from each other. This is the number one cause of wipes on this boss. Mark positions on the floor if people have trouble maintaining spacing. Never clump up.

bosses.strategy: Positioning is everything on this fight. Before pulling, have everyone spread out in a circle around the boss, at least 10 yards apart from each other. Mark positions on the floor if needed. Assign two dispellers to immediately remove Holy Fire from anyone who gets it. Put Blessing of Sacrifice on a healer so they break out of Repentance early. Melee will take constant damage from Holy Ground - healers must keep them topped off. The fight is straightforward once everyone is positioned correctly.
commonMistakes: Standing too close to other players and getting chained by Holy Wrath
Not dispelling Holy Fire quickly enough
No one able to break Repentance, causing deaths during the stun
Healers not pre-applying heal-over-time effects before Repentance

bosses.name: Opera Event
bosses.description: A random theatrical event determined when your raid enters Karazhan for the week. Talk to Barnes the Stage Manager to discover which show you'll face. Each show has completely different mechanics, so be prepared for any of them.

variants.name: The Big Bad Wolf (Red Riding Hood)
variants.description: A single-target fight against a werewolf. Periodically, one player is transformed into Little Red Riding Hood.
variants.keyMechanic: When transformed into Red Riding Hood, you have 50% reduced movement speed, cannot attack, and the Wolf will chase you. If the Wolf catches you, you die instantly.
variants.strategy: Transformed players must RUN IN CIRCLES around the room. Use any movement abilities you have (Sprint, Dash, Blink, travel form). Other players should slow the Wolf with Frost traps, Hamstring, Crippling Poison, and other snares. The Wolf moves slightly faster than a transformed player, so kiting is essential.

variants.name: Romulo and Julianne
variants.description: A two-phase fight against star-crossed lovers. Julianne appears first, then Romulo, and finally both together.
variants.keyMechanic: In the final phase, both must die within 10 seconds of each other. If one dies and the other lives too long, the dead one will resurrect at full health.
variants.strategy: Kill Julianne first while interrupting her heals with Kick, Pummel, or Earth Shock. Kill Romulo second while dispelling his poison stacks on the tank. In the final phase, balance damage on both and kill them simultaneously. Coordinate damage to bring them both below 5% before finishing them off together.

variants.name: The Wizard of Oz
variants.description: A council-style fight against characters from the Wizard of Oz: Dorothee, Roar, Strawman, Tinhead, Tito (the dog), and finally The Crone.
variants.keyMechanic: Each enemy has unique abilities. Dorothee will enrage if Tito dies before her. The Crone only appears after all others are dead.
variants.strategy: Kill order: Dorothee first (stop her Water Bolt spam), then Roar (fears in melee range), then Tinhead (stuns the tank), then Strawman (interrupt his Fireball), then Tito. After all five die, The Crone appears - she is a simple tank-and-spank.

commonMistakes: Wolf: Not kiting properly when transformed, getting caught
Romulo and Julianne: Killing one too fast and having them resurrect
Wizard of Oz: Killing Tito before Dorothee, causing her to enrage

bosses.name: The Curator
bosses.description: A massive arcane construct in the Menagerie. This boss tests your raid's ability to balance killing adds while dealing damage to the boss. The key mechanic is Evocation, when the boss becomes vulnerable.

abilities.name: Hateful Bolt
abilities.description: Every 10 seconds, Curator fires a bolt at the raid member with the HIGHEST health (excluding the main tank) for 4,000-5,000 arcane damage.
abilities.handling: Designate 2-3 'soakers' - plate damage dealers or Hunters using Aspect of the Wild. These players should stay at full health so they absorb the Hateful Bolts instead of healers or cloth wearers. Spread healing across soakers. Arcane resistance gear helps if available.

abilities.name: Summon Astral Flare
abilities.description: Every 10 seconds, Curator summons an Astral Flare add. These adds have 12,000 health and cast chain lightning at nearby players.
abilities.handling: KILL FLARES IMMEDIATELY. Assign ranged damage dealers to switch to flares as soon as they spawn. If flares stack up, the raid damage becomes overwhelming. Warlocks can Banish flares to buy time.

abilities.name: Evocation
abilities.description: When Curator reaches 10% mana, he begins channeling Evocation for 20 seconds to restore his mana. During this time, he takes 200% increased damage (double damage).
abilities.handling: THIS IS YOUR BURN PHASE. Save all damage cooldowns (Heroism/Bloodlust, trinkets, potions) for Evocation. The goal is to either kill the Curator before Evocation ends, or deal enough damage to push another Evocation phase quickly.

abilities.name: Enrage
abilities.description: At 15% health, Curator enrages, increasing his attack speed and damage significantly.
abilities.handling: Save tank defensive cooldowns for the enrage. This should overlap with an Evocation if your damage is good, making it manageable. If you reach enrage outside of Evocation, healers need to work hard to keep the tank alive.

bosses.strategy: Position your raid loosely to avoid chain lightning from flares. Kill every Astral Flare immediately when it spawns - ranged damage dealers should be ready to switch targets. Keep your Hateful Bolt soakers at full health. When Curator runs out of mana and begins Evocation, THIS IS YOUR BURN PHASE. Pop Heroism/Bloodlust, all trinkets, and damage potions. Deal as much damage as possible during the 20-second window. If the boss doesn't die during Evocation, continue killing flares and wait for the next Evocation.
commonMistakes: Letting Astral Flares stack up because damage dealers don't switch targets
Not having designated soakers, causing random players to die to Hateful Bolt
Using Heroism/Bloodlust at the start instead of saving it for Evocation
Tank dying to enrage because healers weren't prepared

bosses.name: Terestian Illhoof
bosses.description: A satyr warlock in the Repository. This fight requires fast target switching and heavy healing. The key mechanic is Demon Chains, which will kill players if not destroyed quickly.

abilities.name: Sacrifice
abilities.description: Illhoof chains a random player to a Demon Chains portal, draining 1,500 health per second. The player cannot act while chained. The chains have approximately 12,000 health.
abilities.handling: ALL damage dealers MUST SWITCH TO DEMON CHAINS IMMEDIATELY when someone gets sacrificed. The chained player will die in about 8 seconds if the chains aren't destroyed. This is the number one cause of wipes - prioritize chains above everything else.

abilities.name: Summon Kil'rek
abilities.description: Kil'rek is Illhoof's imp companion with 75,000 health. While Kil'rek is alive, Illhoof takes 25% reduced damage. Kil'rek respawns 45 seconds after dying.
abilities.handling: Kill Kil'rek at the start of the fight, then focus damage on Illhoof during the 45-second window before Kil'rek returns. When Kil'rek respawns, kill it again and repeat.

abilities.name: Summon Imps
abilities.description: Illhoof continuously summons waves of small imps. Each imp casts Firebolt for 150-200 damage. While individually weak, many imps casting together creates dangerous raid damage.
abilities.handling: Warlock Seed of Corruption is AMAZING for this fight - place it on Illhoof and the exploding seeds will kill imps. Without a Warlock, use area-of-effect abilities like Consecration, Rain of Fire, or Volley. Don't let imps accumulate or raid damage spikes.

abilities.name: Shadow Bolt
abilities.description: A 2-second cast dealing 3,000-4,000 shadow damage to a random player.
abilities.handling: Can be interrupted but it's not the priority. Healers should handle this through healing. Focus interrupts on more dangerous casts if needed.

bosses.strategy: Kill Kil'rek immediately when the fight starts. Have your Warlock (if you have one) spam Seed of Corruption on Illhoof - the explosions will kill imps automatically. Without a Warlock, assign someone to area-of-effect the imps. When ANYONE gets Sacrificed to Demon Chains, EVERYONE switches to kill the chains immediately - this is non-negotiable. After the chains break, return to the boss. Kill Kil'rek again each time it respawns (every 45 seconds). This fight requires heavy healing due to constant imp damage.
commonMistakes: Not switching to Demon Chains fast enough, causing sacrificed players to die
Letting imps stack up because no one is handling area-of-effect damage
Forgetting to kill Kil'rek when it respawns, reducing damage on Illhoof
Healers falling behind on the constant raid damage

bosses.name: Shade of Aran
bosses.description: The shade of Medivh's father, found in the Guardian's Library. This is one of the most mechanics-heavy fights in Karazhan. Aran has NO THREAT TABLE - he attacks randomly. The key rule: during Flame Wreath, DO NOT MOVE.
bosses.criticalRule: DURING FLAME WREATH, DO NOT MOVE. Do not jump. Do not turn your character. Do not use Blink or Charge. Put pets on passive. Moving through ANY flame ring deals massive damage to the ENTIRE RAID and will likely cause a wipe.

abilities.name: Flame Wreath
abilities.description: Places rings of fire around 3 random players lasting 20 seconds. If ANYONE moves through ANY ring, it explodes for approximately 5,000 fire damage to the entire raid.
abilities.handling: STOP MOVING COMPLETELY when Flame Wreath is cast. Do not jump, do not turn, do not strafe, do not use movement abilities. Put pets on passive so they don't walk through rings. This is THE wipe mechanic - one person moving kills everyone.

abilities.name: Blizzard
abilities.description: A rotating Blizzard effect that circles around the room clockwise, dealing heavy frost damage and slowing anyone caught in it.
abilities.handling: Move WITH the rotation, staying ahead of the Blizzard. Don't panic - it follows a predictable clockwise pattern. Watch your feet and walk in the direction the Blizzard is moving.

abilities.name: Arcane Explosion
abilities.description: Aran magnetically pulls the entire raid to the center of the room, then begins a 10-second cast of Arcane Explosion dealing 10,000+ damage to anyone nearby.
abilities.handling: IMMEDIATELY run to the edge of the room when you get pulled to the center. Stand against the wall until the cast finishes. Getting caught in the middle means death.

abilities.name: Mass Polymorph
abilities.description: Polymorphs the entire raid into sheep while Aran drinks to restore mana.
abilities.handling: Wait for the Polymorph to wear off. When it ends, IMMEDIATELY interrupt Aran's Pyroblast with Counterspell, Kick, Shield Bash, or Earth Shock. If Pyroblast goes off, everyone takes 7,000 fire damage.

abilities.name: Summon Water Elementals
abilities.description: At 40% health, Aran summons 4 Water Elementals with 20,000 health each. They spam frost bolts at random targets.
abilities.handling: Burn down the Water Elementals with area-of-effect damage. Warlocks can Banish one. You cannot let them free-cast or the raid damage overwhelms healers.

bosses.strategy: Spread out around the room before pulling - there is no tank, Aran attacks randomly. During Flame Wreath: FREEZE. Do not move for any reason. During Blizzard: move clockwise with the rotation. During Arcane Explosion (pull to center): run to the walls immediately. After Mass Polymorph: interrupt the Pyroblast. At 40% health, burn down the Water Elementals quickly. IMPORTANT: Do not use mana consumables (mana potions, dark runes) while Aran is drinking or it may trigger extra Pyroblasts.
commonMistakes: Moving during Flame Wreath (the most common wipe cause)
Not running to the walls during Arcane Explosion
Failing to interrupt Pyroblast after Mass Polymorph
Using mana consumables while Aran is drinking
Not killing Water Elementals quickly at 40%

bosses.name: Netherspite
bosses.description: A nether dragon with a unique beam mechanic. Three colored beams connect portals to the boss - players must intercept these beams or the fight becomes impossible. The beams provide powerful buffs but also debuffs that stack over time.

red.name: Perseverance (Red/Tank Beam)
red.effect: Reduces damage taken by 1% per stack. Increases damage dealt. BUT reduces maximum health by 1% per stack.
red.handling: Tanks intercept this beam. Swap tanks at 25-30 stacks before the health reduction becomes dangerous. Always have a tank in this beam.

green.name: Serenity (Green/Healer Beam)
green.effect: Restores 300 mana per second. Reduces healing done by 1% per stack. Increases healing received.
green.handling: Rotate 2-3 healers through this beam. Swap at 15-20 stacks before your healing becomes ineffective.

blue.name: Dominance (Blue/Damage Beam)
blue.effect: Increases spell damage by 5% per stack. Reduces maximum health by 1% per stack.
blue.handling: Casters (Warlocks, Mages, Shadow Priests) take this beam. Swap at 30+ stacks when health gets too low. Massive damage potential.

abilities.name: Void Zone
abilities.description: Places purple void zones under random players dealing 1,000 shadow damage per second. Lasts 25 seconds.
abilities.handling: Move out immediately. Don't stand in the purple circles. Simple but deadly if ignored.

abilities.name: Netherburn (Banish Phase)
abilities.description: During the Banish Phase, Netherspite pulses 1,500 shadow damage every 2 seconds to the entire raid.
abilities.handling: Healers focus on area-of-effect healing. Stay spread for Void Zones. Wait for the beam phase to resume.

bosses.strategy: BEAM PHASE: Assign 2 tanks to rotate the red beam, 3 healers to rotate the green beam, and 2-3 casters to rotate the blue beam. Someone must ALWAYS be in each beam - if a beam hits the boss, bad things happen. Track your stacks and call for swaps at the designated thresholds. BANISH PHASE: Netherspite teleports to the center and becomes invulnerable. The raid spreads out, healers keep everyone alive through Netherburn damage. Beams reset. After Banish ends, immediately get back in position for beams. Repeat through 3-4 cycles until the boss dies.
commonMistakes: Letting a beam hit the boss because no one was intercepting
Staying in a beam too long and dying from stacked debuffs
Not calling for beam swaps, causing confusion
Standing in Void Zones
Not spreading during Banish Phase

bosses.name: Chess Event
bosses.description: A fun tactical minigame where players control chess pieces to defeat the enemy king. This is not a traditional boss fight. Each player possesses one chess piece and must use its abilities strategically.
howToPlay: Click on a chess piece to possess it
Each piece has unique abilities - read the tooltips
Move your piece into attack range, then use abilities
Move OUT when your piece takes damage to stay alive
Medivh will occasionally 'cheat' by buffing enemy pieces or damaging yours

pieceRoles.king: Heals adjacent friendly pieces. Keep in the center and use the heal on cooldown.
pieceRoles.queen: Highest damage. Position to attack the enemy king.
pieceRoles.rooks: Area-of-effect fire ability. Good against grouped enemies.

bosses.strategy: Have someone control the King (keep using heal), the Queen (focus the enemy king), and several other pieces. Move pieces into attack range and use their abilities. When your piece gets low, move it away to safety. Focus damage on the enemy King while protecting yours. If enemy healing pieces (clerics) are healing the king, kill them first. This fight is very forgiving - you can attempt it multiple times with no penalty.
commonMistakes: Not moving pieces out when they're taking damage
Ignoring the King's heal ability
Not focusing damage on the enemy King
lootHighlights: The chess chest contains guaranteed epic loot for the raid

bosses.name: Prince Malchezaar
bosses.description: The final boss of Karazhan, an eredar lord on the tower's rooftop. This three-phase fight features escalating damage and constant infernal spawns. Positioning is critical as the room fills up with fire over time.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (100% to 60%): Normal tanking. Enfeeble/Shadow Nova combo. Infernals spawn slowly.
Phase 2 (60% to 30%): Prince equips two axes, tank damage increases dramatically. Sunder Armor stacks.
Phase 3 (30% to 0%): Axes disappear. Infernals spawn faster. Increased damage to tank. BURN.

abilities.name: Enfeeble
abilities.description: Reduces 5 random players (never the tank) to 1 health point for 7 seconds. Healing is reduced by 100% during this time. Health potions and Healthstones do NOT work.
abilities.handling: Enfeebled players must IMMEDIATELY run away from the boss, getting at least 30 yards away. Shadow Nova follows Enfeeble - if you're within range with 1 health, you die instantly.

abilities.name: Shadow Nova
abilities.description: A 3-second cast dealing approximately 3,000 shadow damage in a 30-yard radius. Always follows Enfeeble.
abilities.handling: If you are NOT enfeebled, stay in and continue damage/healing. If you ARE enfeebled, be outside 30 yards or you die. After Shadow Nova, enfeebled players return to normal health.

abilities.name: Summon Infernal
abilities.description: Infernals land at random locations and pulse fire damage (Hellfire) in a radius around them. They do NOT despawn for the entire fight. In Phase 3, they spawn more frequently.
abilities.handling: Tank the Prince in a corner of the room. As infernals land, the raid must kite around the edges of the room, avoiding the fire zones. Do not tank in the open center or you'll run out of room.

abilities.name: Sunder Armor (Phase 2)
abilities.description: Phase 2 only: Prince applies stacking armor reduction to the tank.
abilities.handling: Warriors can use Devastate to remove stacks. Alternatively, swap tanks at 3-5 stacks. This makes the tank very vulnerable if ignored.

abilities.name: Thrash (Phase 2)
abilities.description: Phase 2 only: Prince gains extra attacks, significantly increasing tank damage.
abilities.handling: Use tank defensive cooldowns during Phase 2. Shield Block and Dodge/Parry are very valuable here.

abilities.name: Amplify Damage (Phase 3)
abilities.description: Phase 3: Prince deals increased damage to the tank.
abilities.handling: Save major defensive cooldowns (Pain Suppression, Shield Wall, Last Stand) for Phase 3. This phase is a burn race.

bosses.strategy: POSITIONING: Tank Prince in a corner with your back to the wall. The raid positions between the tank and the center of the room. PHASE 1: Basic tanking. When Enfeeble hits, affected players run out beyond 30 yards. Everyone else continues damage. Move together as a group when infernals force repositioning. PHASE 2: The tank takes dramatically more damage. Use defensive cooldowns. Continue the Enfeeble dance. Warriors should manage Sunder stacks. PHASE 3: This is the burn phase. Infernals spawn rapidly, Prince hits hard. Pop Heroism/Bloodlust, all damage cooldowns, and kill him before the room fills with fire or the tank dies.
commonMistakes: Enfeebled players not running out, dying to Shadow Nova
Tanking in the middle of the room and running out of space from infernals
Not using tank cooldowns in Phase 2, tank dying
Not saving damage cooldowns for the Phase 3 burn
Raid standing near infernals and taking unnecessary fire damage
lootHighlights: Stainless Cloak of the Pure Hearted

bosses.name: Nightbane (Optional Boss)
bosses.description: An optional undead dragon boss on the Master's Terrace (the balcony). Nightbane must be summoned using the Blackened Urn, obtained through a questline starting with Medivh's Journal. This is a long, healing-intensive fight alternating between ground and air phases.
bosses.attunement: Complete the Medivh's Journal questline, which involves collecting items from various Karazhan bosses, to receive the Blackened Urn. Use the urn on the Master's Terrace to summon Nightbane.

abilities.name: Bellowing Roar
abilities.description: A 2.5-second cast area-of-effect fear during ground phases.
abilities.handling: Priests should Fear Ward the tank. Shamans use Tremor Totem. Warriors use Berserker Rage. Tank with your back to a wall so fear doesn't knock you off the balcony.

abilities.name: Charred Earth
abilities.description: Fire patches appear under random players, dealing 1,500 fire damage per second. These last 60 seconds.
abilities.handling: Move out of fire immediately. The ground gets crowded - kite Nightbane to clear areas if needed. Watch your feet constantly.

abilities.name: Smoldering Breath
abilities.description: Frontal cone fire breath dealing 4,000-6,000 damage plus a damage-over-time effect.
abilities.handling: Tank faces the boss away from the raid. Only the tank should be hit by this.

abilities.name: Tail Sweep
abilities.description: A rear cone knockback affecting anyone behind the boss.
abilities.handling: Melee stand at the boss's SIDE, not behind. Getting knocked off the balcony is fatal.

abilities.name: Smoking Blast (Air Phase)
abilities.description: During air phases, Nightbane targets the highest threat (usually the tank) with stacking fire damage-over-time. Each stack increases the damage.
abilities.handling: The tank MUST survive the air phase. Use defensive cooldowns, health potions, Healthstones. Healers spam the tank. At 4+ stacks, damage becomes dangerous.

abilities.name: Rain of Bones (Air Phase)
abilities.description: Targets a random player with an area-of-effect zone. Spawns 5 Restless Skeleton adds (13,000 health each) where it lands.
abilities.handling: THE ENTIRE RAID STACKS ON THE TANK during air phases. This causes all skeletons to spawn in one spot for easy area-of-effect damage. Kill all skeletons before Nightbane lands or they overwhelm the raid.

bosses.strategy: GROUND PHASES (100%-75%, 50%-25%): Tank against a wall to prevent fear knockback. Face the boss away from the raid. Move out of Charred Earth. Fear Ward the tank. At 75%, 50%, and 25% health, Nightbane takes flight. AIR PHASES: The raid stacks on the tank's position. Kill the Restless Skeletons with area-of-effect damage immediately. Healers spam the tank to keep them alive through Smoking Blast stacks. When Nightbane lands, the tank picks him up immediately. This fight is LONG - conserve mana and expect it to take 8-10 minutes.
commonMistakes: Tank getting feared off the balcony because they weren't against a wall
Standing in Charred Earth fire patches
Not stacking during air phase, causing skeletons to spawn in multiple locations
Tank dying during air phase from Smoking Blast stacks
Not killing skeletons before Nightbane lands

gruuls_lair.name: Gruul's Lair
gruuls_lair.description: A short two-boss raid featuring ogre lords. This is often your guild's first 25-player raid. High King Maulgar is a challenging coordination fight, while Gruul himself is a damage race with unique Shatter mechanics.

recommendedComposition.notes: Maulgar REQUIRES a Mage to tank Krosh Firehand. Bring Hunters for kiting Kiggler. Priests are valuable for Shackle if needed.

minimumGear.tanks: 14,000+ health unbuffed, 490 Defense, full Karazhan gear recommended

gruuls_lair.tierTokens: Tier 4 Legs and Shoulders tokens drop here

bosses.name: High King Maulgar
bosses.description: A council-style fight against King Maulgar and his four ogre advisors. Each advisor has unique mechanics requiring different tanks and strategies. This fight tests your raid's ability to coordinate multiple targets simultaneously.

councilMembers.name: Krosh Firehand (Mage)
councilMembers.role: Must be MAGE TANKED. A Mage spellsteals his Spell Shield and tanks him at range.
councilMembers.danger: Will Blast Wave anyone in melee range, causing massive damage.

councilMembers.name: Olm the Summoner (Warlock)
councilMembers.role: Off-tanked away from casters. Summons Felhunters that mana burn.
councilMembers.danger: Death Coil fears the tank. Felhunters destroy caster mana.

councilMembers.name: Kiggler the Crazed (Shaman)
councilMembers.role: HUNTER KITED. Cannot be melee tanked - he polymorphs melee attackers.
councilMembers.danger: Lightning Bolts hurt. Must be kited continuously.

councilMembers.name: Blindeye the Seer (Priest)
councilMembers.role: Off-tanked. His Prayer of Healing heals ALL council members.
councilMembers.danger: MUST DIE FIRST or the fight becomes impossible due to healing.

abilities.name: Arcing Smash
abilities.description: Maulgar's frontal cone dealing 7,000-8,000 physical damage.
abilities.handling: Tank Maulgar facing away from the raid. Only the main tank should be in front of him.

abilities.name: Mighty Blow
abilities.description: Knockback on Maulgar's current target.
abilities.handling: Tank with your back to a wall to avoid positioning problems.

abilities.name: Whirlwind
abilities.description: Maulgar spins, dealing massive damage to anyone in melee range for 8 seconds.
abilities.handling: ALL MELEE RUN OUT immediately when Whirlwind starts. Return when it ends.

abilities.name: Berserker Charge (50% HP)
abilities.description: At 50% health, Maulgar gains Berserker Charge, randomly charging raid members.
abilities.handling: This is why you kill all adds before focusing Maulgar. Stay spread loosely.

bosses.strategy: PULL ASSIGNMENTS: Main Tank grabs Maulgar (tank against wall). Off-Tank 1 grabs Olm (tank away from casters). Mage tanks Krosh (Spellsteal his shield!). Hunter kites Kiggler (never stop moving). Off-Tank 2 grabs Blindeye. KILL ORDER: Blindeye first (interrupt his heals!), then Olm, then Kiggler (Hunter keeps kiting until it's his turn), then Krosh (Mage keeps tanking until it's his turn), and finally Maulgar. At 50% Maulgar health, he begins charging randomly - burn him down.
commonMistakes: Mage dying because they didn't Spellsteal Krosh's shield
Not interrupting Blindeye's heals, making the fight take forever
Melee not running from Maulgar's Whirlwind
Kiggler killing people because the Hunter stopped kiting
Not having the correct number of tanks assigned

bosses.name: Gruul the Dragonkiller
bosses.description: A massive gronn in a circular arena. Gruul grows stronger every 30 seconds, making this a race against time. The unique Shatter mechanic requires the raid to spread out after being slowed and turned to stone.
bosses.keyMechanic: Growth: Every 30 seconds, Gruul gains 15% increased damage. This stacks up to 30 times. You MUST kill him before stacks get too high or the tank cannot survive.

abilities.name: Growth
abilities.description: Every 30 seconds, Gruul gains 15% increased damage permanently. Stacks up to 30 times (450% total increase).
abilities.handling: This is the soft enrage timer. You must kill Gruul before 8-10 stacks or tank deaths become unavoidable. Use damage cooldowns EARLY, not late - the fight gets harder over time.

abilities.name: Ground Slam
abilities.description: Knocks back the entire raid and applies Gronn Lord's Grasp, a stacking slow that eventually roots everyone in stone.
abilities.handling: After the knockback, you have approximately 5 seconds before you turn to stone. SPREAD OUT as much as possible during this time.

abilities.name: Shatter
abilities.description: After everyone turns to stone, Gruul shatters the effect. Damage is based on PROXIMITY to other players: 0-5 yards = 8,000-9,000 damage, 6-10 yards = 4,000-5,000 damage, 11-15 yards = 2,000 damage, 16+ yards = no damage.
abilities.handling: BE SPREAD OUT when you turn to stone. Minimum 15 yards apart from everyone else. THIS IS THE MAIN WIPE MECHANIC. Divine Shield and Ice Block prevent turning to stone but NOT Shatter damage.

abilities.name: Hurtful Strike
abilities.description: Every 8 seconds, Gruul hits the raid member with the highest health in melee range (excluding the main tank) for 12,000+ physical damage.
abilities.handling: You MUST have an off-tank in melee range to soak these hits. The off-tank should be second on threat. If no off-tank is present, a damage dealer will die.

abilities.name: Reverberation
abilities.description: 4-second area-of-effect silence.
abilities.handling: Healers should pre-apply heal-over-time effects. Not hugely threatening but can be annoying during critical moments.

abilities.name: Cave In
abilities.description: Rocks fall at random locations, dealing 3,000 physical damage per second to anyone standing in them.
abilities.handling: Move out of the dusty ground circles. Simple but deadly if you're rooted in stone inside one.

bosses.strategy: POSITIONING: Spread around the room edges. Main tank and off-tank stay in the center. The off-tank must be in melee range to soak Hurtful Strikes. GROUND SLAM SEQUENCE: When Ground Slam hits, use any movement abilities to spread even further. You have 5 seconds before turning to stone. After Shatter, regroup (loosely) and continue damage. POP COOLDOWNS EARLY: Use Heroism/Bloodlust and damage trinkets in the first 2-3 minutes. Growth makes the fight exponentially harder, so front-load your damage. This is a DPS race - you have approximately 4-5 minutes before Growth overwhelms healing.
commonMistakes: Not spreading for Shatter, causing massive raid damage
Not having an off-tank to soak Hurtful Strike
Saving damage cooldowns too long - use them early
Standing in Cave In rocks while rooted
Tank dying because Growth stacks got too high

magtheridons_lair.name: Magtheridon's Lair
magtheridons_lair.description: A single-boss raid featuring the pit lord Magtheridon, imprisoned beneath Hellfire Citadel. This fight requires precise coordination with 5 players clicking cubes simultaneously to interrupt a devastating ability.

recommendedComposition.notes: Designate 5 reliable players as 'cube clickers' BEFORE the fight. These players must click Manticron Cubes simultaneously.

bosses.name: Magtheridon
bosses.description: A pit lord imprisoned by 5 Hellfire Channelers. The fight has two phases: killing the Channelers while Magtheridon is banished, then fighting Magtheridon while coordinating cube clicks to interrupt his Blast Nova.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (Channelers): Kill all 5 Hellfire Channelers while Magtheridon is banished. Interrupt their heals. Handle Burning Abyssal adds.
Phase 2 (Magtheridon): Tank Magtheridon. 5 designated players must click Manticron Cubes simultaneously to interrupt Blast Nova. At 30%, the ceiling collapses.
bosses.cubeClickMechanic: 5 Manticron Cubes are positioned around the room. When Magtheridon casts Blast Nova (a 20-second cast), 5 designated players must click their assigned cubes within 1 second of each other. This banishes Magtheridon and interrupts the cast. Missing the click means half the raid dies.

abilities.name: Blast Nova
abilities.description: A 20-second cast that deals 50% of every player's maximum health as fire damage. Cast repeatedly during Phase 2.
abilities.handling: 5 DESIGNATED CLICKERS must click Manticron Cubes simultaneously to banish Magtheridon and interrupt this cast. Use voice communication with a countdown: '5-4-3-2-1-CLICK'. Missing this is catastrophic.

abilities.name: Cleave
abilities.description: Frontal cleave dealing 7,000-10,000 physical damage.
abilities.handling: Tank faces Magtheridon away from the raid. Only the tank should be in front.

abilities.name: Quake
abilities.description: Raid-wide knockback and spell interruption every 40 seconds.
abilities.handling: Casters should stop casting during Quake. Brief interruption - resume immediately after.

abilities.name: Cave In (30% HP)
abilities.description: At 30% health, the ceiling collapses. The entire raid takes 5,000-8,000 physical damage every 2 seconds for the rest of the fight.
abilities.handling: THIS IS THE BURN PHASE. Pop all remaining cooldowns. Heroism/Bloodlust if not used. Healers spam area-of-effect heals. You must kill Magtheridon quickly or healers run out of mana.

abilities.name: Channeler Shadow Bolt Volley
abilities.description: Phase 1: Channelers cast shadow bolts at random targets.
abilities.handling: Kill Channelers quickly. Assign a kill order.

abilities.name: Channeler Dark Mending
abilities.description: Phase 1: Channelers heal each other for significant amounts.
abilities.handling: INTERRUPT with Kick, Pummel, Earth Shock, Shield Bash. If they heal, Phase 1 takes forever.

abilities.name: Burning Abyssal (Phase 1)
abilities.description: Channelers periodically spawn fire elemental adds.
abilities.handling: Off-tank picks up Abyssals. Kill them after Channelers die or they accumulate and overwhelm.

bosses.strategy: PHASE 1: Pull all 5 Channelers to the center. Assign 2-3 tanks to hold them. Assign an interrupt rotation for Dark Mending heals. DPS burns them down while an off-tank handles Burning Abyssal adds. This phase should take about 2 minutes. PHASE 2: When Magtheridon becomes active, your main tank picks him up and faces him away. 5 DESIGNATED CLICKERS position at their assigned cubes. When Blast Nova starts casting, the raid leader counts down: '5-4-3-2-1-CLICK'. All 5 clickers click simultaneously. Repeat for every Blast Nova. AT 30%: Ceiling collapses. BURN. Pop everything. Kill him before healers go out of mana.
commonMistakes: Cube clickers not clicking simultaneously, failing to interrupt Blast Nova
Not interrupting Channeler heals in Phase 1
Tank dying at 30% because healers can't keep up with Cave In damage
Abyssal adds overwhelming the raid in Phase 1
Cube clickers dying before Phase 2 - protect them!

phase2.name: Phase 2: Tier 5 Content
phase2.description: The second raiding tier introduces Serpentshrine Cavern and Tempest Keep: The Eye. These raids are significantly more challenging than Tier 4 and drop Tier 5 armor tokens.

serpentshrine_cavern.name: Serpentshrine Cavern
serpentshrine_cavern.attunement: The Cudgel of Kar'desh (requires killing Nightbane in Karazhan and Gruul)
serpentshrine_cavern.description: Lady Vashj's underwater stronghold beneath Zangarmarsh. This 25-player raid features 6 challenging bosses and introduces many complex mechanics that will test raid coordination. Heavy resistance gear is required for multiple encounters. Most guilds spend 2-3 months progressing through this instance.

recommendedComposition.notes: Bring 2 Frost Resist tanks and 2 Nature Resist tanks for Hydross. A Warlock tank is mandatory for Leotheras. Multiple Mages help with add control on Vashj. Shamans are valuable for Heroism/Bloodlust timing.

minimumGear.tanks: 15,000+ health unbuffed, resistance sets for Hydross (365 Frost/Nature buffed)

serpentshrine_cavern.tierTokens: Tier 5 Gloves, Helm, and Legs tokens drop here

bosses.name: Hydross the Unstable
bosses.description: A water elemental that alternates between Frost and Nature forms based on position. Crossing the threshold (marked by banners) triggers a form change and spawns 4 elemental adds. This fight is entirely about controlled transitions and proper resistance gear - DPS is secondary to execution.
phaseBreakdown: Frost Form: Hydross deals Frost damage and applies Mark of Hydross. Tank requires 365 Frost resistance (332 gear + buffs). Water Tomb stuns random players.
Nature Form: Hydross deals Nature damage and applies Mark of Corruption. Tank requires 365 Nature resistance. Vile Sludge reduces healing by 50%.
Transition: Crossing threshold spawns 4 Pure Spawn adds dealing 4-5k damage each. Aggro resets completely on Hydross.

abilities.name: Mark of Hydross
abilities.description: Applies every 15 seconds in Frost form. Each stack increases Frost damage taken by 10%. After 4 stacks, even resistance-geared tanks take massive damage.
abilities.handling: Transition to Nature form before reaching 5-6 stacks. Stop all DPS at 3-4 stacks to prepare for transition. DoT classes must be especially careful.

abilities.name: Mark of Corruption
abilities.description: Applies every 15 seconds in Nature form. Each stack increases Nature damage taken by 10%. Generally less threatening than Frost marks.
abilities.handling: Same as Mark of Hydross - transition around 4-5 stacks. Nature phase is considered slightly easier.

abilities.name: Water Tomb
abilities.description: Encases a random player and nearby allies in a water tomb, stunning them for 5 seconds and dealing 900 Frost damage per second (4,500 total).
abilities.handling: Spread out at least 6 yards to prevent chain-tombing. Healers must immediately heal tombed players - they'll drop to 50% health or lower.

abilities.name: Vile Sludge
abilities.description: Coats a target in sludge, reducing damage and healing done by 50% and dealing 500 Nature damage every 3 seconds for 24 seconds.
abilities.handling: Dispel immediately if on a healer or tank. Magic dispel only. If on DPS, can wait for a GCD but don't delay too long.

abilities.name: Purify Elemental
abilities.description: Clears all threat when transitioning between forms. Hydross will attack whoever is closest after transition.
abilities.handling: The new resistance tank must be in position and ready to immediately generate threat. All DPS must stop completely during transition.

bosses.strategy: Position Hydross at the threshold (marked by banners on the floor). Frost resist tank pulls and tanks in clean water. At 4-5 stacks, all DPS stops and the Nature resist tank taunts Hydross across the threshold. Four adds spawn - off-tanks pick them up and raid AoEs them down quickly while staying on boss. Repeat this cycle, alternating forms every 4-5 marks. The fight is won by clean transitions with minimal raid damage. Enrage timer is 10 minutes - DPS is not the issue, execution is.
commonMistakes: Tanks not having enough resistance (365 buffed required)
DPS not stopping before transitions, pulling Hydross across accidentally with DoTs
Raid members standing too close and getting chain-tombed
Not dispelling Vile Sludge on tanks
Adds running loose during transition and killing healers

bosses.name: The Lurker Below
bosses.description: A colossal fish lurking beneath Serpentshrine Cavern's central pool. The Lurker must be fished up using 300+ fishing skill. The fight takes place on platforms surrounding a large pool - positioning and the Spout mechanic define this encounter. Learning to recognize and react to Spout is the key skill.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (Active): Lurker is targetable. Tank in pool, raid on platforms. Avoid Spout by submerging. Watch for Whirl and Geyser.
Phase 2 (Submerge): At 2 minutes, Lurker submerges. Adds spawn on platforms - 2 Guardians (tanked) and 6 Ambushers (killed fast). Get out of water!
Repeat: Lurker resurfaces, repeat Phase 1. This cycle continues until boss dies.

abilities.name: Spout
abilities.description: The Lurker rotates 360 degrees while spewing a water jet. Anyone caught takes 4,500 Frost damage and is knocked back 100 yards (into the cavern walls = death). The rotation takes about 25 seconds to complete.
abilities.handling: JUMP INTO THE WATER and SUBMERGE (swim down) when Spout starts. Stay underwater until the beam passes your position. You'll see the boss slowly rotating - only surface when the beam has gone past. Timing is everything. Watch for Lurker to stop attacking and rear back - this signals Spout is coming.

abilities.name: Whirl
abilities.description: Knocks back all players within 15 yards, dealing 3,000-4,000 Physical damage and reducing threat by 50%. Used frequently during Phase 1.
abilities.handling: Melee must constantly reposition after Whirl. Threat can be tricky - tanks should use high-threat abilities after each Whirl. Ranged should stay at max range to avoid being knocked into the water.

abilities.name: Geyser
abilities.description: Targets a random player and erupts a water geyser beneath them after 2 seconds, dealing 3,500-4,500 Frost damage to anyone within 10 yards and launching them into the air.
abilities.handling: Spread out on platforms - at least 10 yards apart. When you see the geyser animation under you or nearby, move away immediately. If launched into air, try to land on a platform, not in the water during adds phase.

abilities.name: Water Bolt
abilities.description: Ranged attack dealing 5,500-6,500 Frost damage to a random target when no one is in melee range.
abilities.handling: Keep the tank in melee range at all times. If the tank gets knocked back by Whirl, they must immediately swim back. Water Bolt spam will quickly kill healers and ranged.

abilities.name: Scalding Water
abilities.description: The pool water deals 500 Fire damage per second to anyone swimming in it. During Submerge phase, the damage increases significantly.
abilities.handling: Only enter water to avoid Spout, then get out immediately. During Submerge phase, DO NOT BE IN THE WATER - the damage ramps up and you will die. Get onto platforms before Lurker submerges.

abilities.name: Coilfang Guardian (Add)
abilities.description: Two Naga melee adds spawn on the inner platforms during Submerge. They hit hard and have significant health.
abilities.handling: Tanks must be on platforms ready to pick these up. They can be crowd controlled (Polymorph, Hibernate) while DPS focuses on Ambushers first. Kill after Ambushers die.

abilities.name: Coilfang Ambusher (Add)
abilities.description: Six archer adds spawn on the outer platforms during Submerge. They Multi-Shot and deal moderate ranged damage.
abilities.handling: KILL THESE FIRST. They have low health but their combined damage is dangerous. Ranged DPS should prioritize these immediately. Warlocks can Fear, Mages can Frost Nova. Get them down fast.

bosses.strategy: SETUP: Position tanks in the water near the boss, melee on the closest platform edge, ranged spread across other platforms. Assign tanks to specific platforms for add pickup. PHASE 1: Tank and spank. When Lurker rears back for Spout, EVERYONE jumps into water and submerges - surface only after beam passes. Tank swims back quickly after Whirl. SUBMERGE: Get out of the water immediately! Tanks pick up Guardians on inner platforms. DPS burns all 6 Ambushers first, then kills Guardians. When Lurker resurfaces, tank gets back in water, repeat. ENRAGE: 10 minutes. With good execution, you'll kill him in 6-7 minutes.
commonMistakes: Not recognizing the Spout wind-up animation and getting knocked off the platforms
Staying in the water during Submerge phase and dying to Scalding Water
Not spreading on platforms, causing Geyser to hit multiple people
Tank not getting back to melee range after Whirl, causing Water Bolt spam
Killing Guardians before Ambushers, letting ranged add damage stack up

bosses.name: Leotheras the Blind
bosses.description: A Blood Elf demon hunter imprisoned by Lady Vashj, Leotheras channels Illidan's dual nature - shifting between his Blood Elf form and a fearsome Demon form. This fight requires a Warlock tank (non-negotiable) and tests every raid member's ability to defeat their own Inner Demon. One of the most mechanically demanding fights in SSC.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (Blood Elf - 100% to 60%): Leotheras in humanoid form. Tank faces away, melee watch for Whirlwind. Cycles between Blood Elf and Demon forms.
Phase 2 (Demon - 60 seconds each cycle): Demon form ignores normal threat - Warlock tank required. Inner Demons spawn for random players.
Phase 3 (Split - 15% HP): BOTH forms exist simultaneously. Blood Elf and Demon must both be tanked. Burn phase - pop cooldowns.

warlockTankRequirements.gear: 285+ Shadow Resistance, 10,000+ HP buffed, 200+ spell damage minimum
warlockTankRequirements.talents: Soul Link and Demonic Sacrifice essential
warlockTankRequirements.consumables: Shadow Protection Potion, Healthstones, Master Healthstone
warlockTankRequirements.rotation: Searing Pain spam for threat. Life Tap as needed but carefully.

abilities.name: Whirlwind
abilities.description: In Blood Elf form, Leotheras spins in place for 12 seconds, dealing 3,000-5,000 Physical damage per second to anyone within 10 yards. He does NOT move during this - but the damage is lethal.
abilities.handling: When Whirlwind starts (you'll see him spin), ALL melee and tanks RUN OUT immediately. Stay at 15+ yards until it ends. Ranged and healers continue as normal. After Whirlwind, tank re-engages and faces him away from raid.

abilities.name: Chaos Blast
abilities.description: In Demon form, blasts the highest threat target for 1,500-2,500 Fire damage. Cast every 2 seconds. Applies a debuff increasing Fire damage taken by 1,675 for 45 seconds. Stacks.
abilities.handling: WARLOCK TANK takes all Chaos Blasts. With Shadow/Fire resistance gear, the damage is manageable. Healers must keep the Warlock alive - assign 2-3 healers specifically. If anyone pulls aggro from the Warlock, they die instantly.

abilities.name: Demon Form Transition
abilities.description: Every 60 seconds, Leotheras transforms into Demon form for 60 seconds, then returns to Blood Elf form. Threat is separate between forms.
abilities.handling: Warlock must be ready to immediately grab threat when Demon form activates. The Warlock should pre-cast Searing Pain to land right as he transforms. Warrior tank holds threat in Blood Elf form and steps back during Demon phases.

abilities.name: Inner Demon
abilities.description: During Demon form, 5 random raid members spawn a personal Inner Demon. ONLY YOU can damage YOUR Inner Demon. If you don't kill it within 30 seconds, you become permanently Mind Controlled for the rest of the fight.
abilities.handling: DROP EVERYTHING and kill your Inner Demon immediately. It has approximately 6,000 HP. Melee classes should have no issue. Healers and casters need instant casts and wands. If you get MC'd, you will likely wipe the raid. Practice this - it's the #1 wipe mechanic.

abilities.name: Insidious Whisper
abilities.description: The debuff that spawns your Inner Demon. Cannot be dispelled. You have 30 seconds.
abilities.handling: You'll see a demon spawn near you with YOUR class icon. Target it immediately. Healers: use instant heals on yourself and wand. Shadow Priests can dot. Every class can kill their demon if they react fast.

abilities.name: Clear Aggro
abilities.description: When transitioning between Blood Elf and Demon forms, threat resets completely.
abilities.handling: Both tanks must be ready to establish threat quickly. The Warrior during Blood Elf form, the Warlock during Demon form. DPS should hold back for 2-3 seconds after each transition.

bosses.strategy: POSITIONING: Tank Leotheras in the center of his pool area, facing away from raid. Melee stack behind him. Ranged spread loosely at max range. Warlock tank stands at range until Demon phase. BLOOD ELF PHASE: Standard tanking. When Whirlwind starts, melee RUN OUT, ranged continue DPS. DEMON PHASE: Warlock immediately taunts and spams Searing Pain. Healers focus the Warlock. When Inner Demons spawn, EVERYONE kills their own demon - this is not optional. PHASE 3 (15%): Both forms exist at once! Warrior tanks Blood Elf, Warlock tanks Demon. Pop Heroism/Bloodlust and all cooldowns. Burn him before the chaos becomes unmanageable.
commonMistakes: Melee not running from Whirlwind and dying in seconds
Warlock tank not pre-casting Searing Pain and losing threat on Demon phase
Raid members not killing their Inner Demon in time and getting MC'd
Healers tunnel-visioning on tanks and dying to their own Inner Demon
Not having a properly geared Warlock tank - this fight REQUIRES one

bosses.name: Fathom-Lord Karathress
bosses.description: A council-style encounter where Fathom-Lord Karathress is joined by three powerful advisors. Each advisor killed transfers their abilities to Karathress, making the kill order critical. This fight demands excellent coordination between multiple tanks and a solid understanding of each advisor's mechanics. Proper interrupt rotations are mandatory.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (All Alive): Tank all 4 enemies separately. Focus DPS on advisors in kill order. Karathress stays in his starting position.
Phase 2 (1 Advisor Dead): Karathress gains first ability. Continue kill order.
Phase 3 (2 Advisors Dead): Karathress gains second ability. Damage ramps up.
Phase 4 (Karathress Only): All three abilities active on Karathress. Burn phase with Heroism/Bloodlust.

advisors.name: Fathom-Guard Caribdis
abilities: Healing Wave: 3-second cast healing an ally for 30,000-50,000. MUST BE INTERRUPTED every time.
Water Bolt Volley: AoE Frost damage to the raid. Interruptible but lower priority than heals.
Tidal Surge: Buffs an ally with attack speed. Dispel with Purge/Dispel Magic.
advisors.tankStrategy: Can be tanked by anyone since she's a caster. Face away from raid. Assign 2-3 interrupters with a rotation to stop every Healing Wave.

advisors.name: Fathom-Guard Tidalvess
abilities: Spitfire Totem: Places a totem that shoots fireballs. Kill totem immediately.
Frost Shock: Instant Frost damage and slow on current target.
Windfury: Melee attacks have chance for extra attacks. Makes him dangerous to tanks.
advisors.tankStrategy: Requires a geared tank. Kill his Spitfire Totems instantly - they deal significant raid damage. Can be tanked near Karathress but keep some distance.

advisors.name: Fathom-Guard Sharkkis
abilities: Multi-Shot: AoE physical damage to multiple targets in front.
Leeching Throw: Drains health and transfers it to Sharkkis.
The Beast Below: Summons a pet shark that needs to be kited or offtanked.
advisors.tankStrategy: Kite-tank the pet shark with a Frost Mage or Hunter. Main tank handles Sharkkis. Keep raid spread to minimize Multi-Shot damage.

abilities.name: Cataclysmic Bolt
abilities.description: Karathress's core ability. Deals damage equal to 50% of the target's maximum health as Nature damage. Used on his current target (usually the tank).
abilities.handling: Cannot be resisted, avoided, or mitigated. Healers MUST keep the Karathress tank at 60%+ health at ALL times. If tank is at 50% when this hits, they die. Assign dedicated healers to this tank.

abilities.name: Enrage
abilities.description: At 25% HP, Karathress enrages, increasing damage dealt by 50%.
abilities.handling: Save Heroism/Bloodlust for this phase. Burn him down. Tank cooldowns and heavy healing required.

abilities.name: Sear Nova (from Caribdis)
abilities.description: After Caribdis dies, Karathress gains this ability. AoE Fire damage to everyone within 20 yards.
abilities.handling: Melee stay at max melee range. Pre-heal before each Nova. Paladins can use Fire Resistance Aura.

abilities.name: Tidal Surge (from Tidalvess)
abilities.description: After Tidalvess dies, Karathress gains this ability. Frost damage and knockback to the tank plus nearby players.
abilities.handling: Tank Karathress against a wall to prevent knockback into the raid. Melee should not stack directly behind the tank.

abilities.name: Beast Within (from Sharkkis)
abilities.description: After Sharkkis dies, Karathress summons his own pet and gains increased attack speed.
abilities.handling: Off-tank picks up the pet. It doesn't hit hard but adds cleave danger. Can be CC'd or just tanked.

bosses.strategy: POSITIONING: Tank Karathress in his starting position throughout the fight. Pull advisors to separate locations - assign one tank per advisor. KILL ORDER: Caribdis FIRST (interrupt all heals), Tidalvess second (kill totems), Sharkkis third (kite pet), Karathress last. Interrupt rotation is critical - 2-3 players should rotate kicks on Caribdis. As advisors die, Karathress gains their abilities - the fight gets progressively harder. At 25%, Karathress enrages - pop Bloodlust and all cooldowns. Keep the Karathress tank above 60% health AT ALL TIMES due to Cataclysmic Bolt.
commonMistakes: Not interrupting Caribdis heals, making the fight take forever
Letting Karathress tank drop below 50% HP and dying to Cataclysmic Bolt
Not killing Spitfire Totems, causing heavy raid damage
Wrong kill order - killing Sharkkis first makes the fight significantly harder
Not positioning Karathress against a wall after Tidalvess dies, causing knockback chaos

bosses.name: Morogrim Tidewalker
bosses.description: A massive sea giant guarding the entrance to Lady Vashj's lair. Morogrim is a stamina and DPS check fight - your raid needs enough health to survive Watery Grave and enough AoE damage to quickly clear murloc waves. This fight punishes low DPS with endless murloc swarms overwhelming the raid.
phaseBreakdown: Main Phase: Tank and spank Morogrim. Healers top off Watery Grave targets. Repeat until Earthquake.
Murloc Phase: Earthquake spawns 12 murlocs. AoE them down fast. Return to Main Phase.
Cycle: Alternates between these phases until Morogrim dies or healers run out of mana.

abilities.name: Tidal Wave
abilities.description: Frontal cone attack dealing 5,000-7,000 Frost damage to anyone in a 25-yard cone in front of Morogrim. 2-second cast.
abilities.handling: ONLY the tank should EVER be in front of Morogrim. Position raid behind and to the sides. Tank should have Frost Resistance Aura if available. This will one-shot or severely damage non-tanks.

abilities.name: Watery Grave
abilities.description: Teleports 4 random players to graves in the corners of the room. They are stunned in a water bubble for 6 seconds, taking 4,500 Frost damage over the duration. When released, Watery Globules spawn and chase them.
abilities.handling: Healers MUST pre-assign healing to grave targets. Each corner should have a healer watching. When players are released, they need immediate healing as they'll be at 25-40% health. The 4 second stun means HoTs applied beforehand help significantly.

abilities.name: Watery Globules
abilities.description: 4 water globes spawn and slowly move toward the players who were just in Watery Grave. If a globe reaches its target, it explodes for 4,500 Frost damage to everyone within 10 yards.
abilities.handling: Grave targets must RUN AWAY from their globe immediately upon release. Run THROUGH the raid toward the boss - the globes are slow. If you can't escape, make sure you're not near other players when it hits. Frost Nova and slows work on globes.

abilities.name: Earthquake
abilities.description: Every 45-50 seconds, Morogrim stomps the ground, dealing 2,500 Nature damage to the entire raid and spawning 12 Murlocs from the water on both sides of the room.
abilities.handling: This is your AoE CHECK. Mages use Blizzard/Flamestrike, Warlocks use Seed of Corruption, Warriors use Whirlwind. Murlocs have low HP (~4,000) but deal significant damage in groups. If murlocs aren't dead before the next Earthquake, they stack and eventually overwhelm the raid.

abilities.name: Murloc Tidal Spawn
abilities.description: The 12 murlocs that spawn during Earthquake. They aggro random players and deal moderate melee damage. If left unchecked, subsequent waves stack.
abilities.handling: Assign dedicated AoE positions. Two groups of ranged DPS should be positioned to catch murlocs spawning from each side. Tanks can help gather them with Challenging Shout or Thunder Clap. Kill ALL murlocs before returning to boss damage.

bosses.strategy: POSITIONING: Tank Morogrim facing away from raid. Spread healers to cover Watery Grave corners. Group ranged DPS in two positions to handle murlocs from both sides. MAIN PHASE: Simple tank and spank. Watch for Watery Grave - heal those targets immediately upon release. Grave targets run toward boss to escape Globules. MURLOC PHASE: When Earthquake hits, STOP BOSS DPS and AoE murlocs. This is critical - if you fall behind on murlocs, you will wipe. Once murlocs are dead, return to boss. ENRAGE: 10 minutes. The fight is a DPS and healer mana check. Bring mana potions and Dark Runes for healers.
commonMistakes: Anyone besides the tank standing in front of Morogrim and eating Tidal Wave
Not healing Watery Grave targets immediately, letting them die to Globules
Grave targets running the wrong direction and exploding Globules on the raid
Not killing murlocs fast enough, causing waves to stack
Healers running out of mana because the fight took too long

bosses.name: Lady Vashj
bosses.description: The Naga sea witch and final boss of Serpentshrine Cavern. Lady Vashj is one of the most complex and demanding encounters in TBC, requiring flawless coordination during the infamous Phase 2 Tainted Core relay system. This fight is the guild-breaker of Tier 5 - many raids never defeat her. Master Phase 2 or wipe forever.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (100%-70% HP): Tank and spank with spreading mechanics. Learn the Static Charge and Entangle patterns.
Phase 2 (70%-50% HP): Vashj becomes IMMUNE. Four Shield Generators must be deactivated using Tainted Cores. Three add types spawn continuously. This phase tests raid coordination to the limit.
Phase 3 (50%-0% HP): Shield down, Vashj attackable again. All Phase 1 abilities plus Toxic Spore Bats. Pure chaos - burn her before healers run out of mana.

phase2Mechanics.shieldGenerators: Four generators in cardinal directions (N/E/S/W) must each be deactivated with a Tainted Core. Vashj is immune until all 4 are down.
phase2Mechanics.taintedCores: Dropped by Tainted Elementals. Player holding a core is ROOTED and takes 500 nature damage/sec. Must throw to another player (45 yard range) who catches and relays it to the generator.
phase2Mechanics.coreRelay: Assign relay teams for each generator direction. Looter picks up core  throws to relay 1  relay 1 throws to relay 2  relay 2 uses core on generator. Practice this!

phase2Adds.name: Coilfang Elite
phase2Adds.handling: Spawn from the stairs. Must be tanked by off-tanks. They hit hard - keep tanks alive. Kill when there's downtime from cores.

phase2Adds.name: Coilfang Strider
phase2Adds.handling: MOST DANGEROUS ADD. Mind Controls random players if it reaches them. Must be KITED by a Frost Mage or Hunter. NEVER let it reach the raid. Perma-slow and kite in circles.

phase2Adds.name: Tainted Elemental
phase2Adds.handling: Spawn near generators. Kill immediately - they despawn after 15 seconds and drop the Tainted Core. Miss too many and Phase 2 becomes impossible.

phase2Adds.name: Enchanted Elemental
phase2Adds.handling: Weak adds that heal Vashj if they reach her. Kill with cleave damage or have a dedicated add tank.

abilities.name: Shoot
abilities.description: Ranged attack dealing 4,000-6,000 Physical damage. Used on her primary threat target in Phases 1 and 3. Also Multi-Shots in Phase 3.
abilities.handling: Tank stands at max range. Use high-stamina gear. In Phase 3, this hurts more due to her damage buff.

abilities.name: Shock Blast
abilities.description: 8-yard AoE around Vashj dealing 8,000-9,000 Nature damage. 5-second cast with visual warning.
abilities.handling: MELEE RUN OUT when you see the cast bar. Return after it goes off. This will one-shot most melee if they don't move.

abilities.name: Static Charge
abilities.description: Debuff on a random player that chains 2,000 Nature damage to anyone within 10 yards every 2 seconds for 20 seconds.
abilities.handling: SPREAD OUT 12+ yards at all times. If you get Static Charge, do NOT move toward other players. Stay isolated until it expires. Getting Static Charged while grouped causes a chain reaction wipe.

abilities.name: Entangle
abilities.description: Roots 5 random players in place and spawns a Spore Bat on each. Bats explode for 2,000 Nature damage in a radius when killed.
abilities.handling: Kill the bats fast, but not when people are clumped. Ranged DPS should focus bats. Rooted players can still cast and attack. The root breaks after a few seconds.

abilities.name: Tainted Core
abilities.description: Phase 2 item dropped by Tainted Elementals. Holding it roots you and deals damage over time. Can be thrown to another player within 45 yards.
abilities.handling: Assign core relay teams before the pull. The player who loots the core throws to their relay partner using a /use Tainted Core macro. The final person in the relay uses the core on the generator. Do NOT hold a core for more than 5-6 seconds or you die.

abilities.name: Forked Lightning
abilities.description: Phase 3 only. Chain lightning hitting multiple targets for 2,500 Nature damage each.
abilities.handling: Stay spread. Healers need to react quickly to top people off. This adds significant raid damage in Phase 3.

abilities.name: Toxic Spore Bat
abilities.description: Phase 3 only. Spawns bats that leave a poison cloud when they die. Clouds deal heavy Nature damage.
abilities.handling: Ranged DPS kills bats AWAY from the raid. Do not kill them near melee or the tank. The clouds are deadly.

bosses.strategy: PHASE 1: Tank Vashj at her platform. Raid spreads out 12+ yards for Static Charge. Melee run out during Shock Blast. Kill Spore Bats when Entangle happens. Simple phase - use it to learn the rhythm. PHASE 2: This is the guild-breaker. Split raid into 4 teams (one per generator direction). Each team has: 1 core looter, 1-2 relay throwers, 1 person to use core on generator. Tanks handle Coilfang Elites. Frost Mage kites Striders PERMANENTLY. When Tainted Elementals spawn, kill them fast, loot the core, relay to generator. You need 4 successful core relays to end Phase 2. Communication is CRITICAL. PHASE 3: Pop Heroism/Bloodlust immediately. All Phase 1 mechanics plus Forked Lightning and Spore Bats. Kill bats away from raid. Burn Vashj before healers go OOM. This phase is pure chaos - if Phase 2 took too long, you won't have the mana to finish.
commonMistakes: Not spreading 12 yards for Static Charge - chains kill multiple people
Holding Tainted Core too long and dying instead of throwing it
Letting Striders reach the raid and Mind Control people
Missing Tainted Elemental spawns in Phase 2, extending the phase
Killing Spore Bats near the raid in Phase 3, creating death clouds
Not practicing core relay before pulling - Phase 2 requires precise coordination

tempest_keep.name: Tempest Keep: The Eye
tempest_keep.attunement: The Tempest Key (requires killing Lady Vashj in SSC)
tempest_keep.description: Kael'thas Sunstrider's flying fortress. Features 4 bosses culminating in the epic Kael'thas encounter, one of the most complex fights in TBC.

recommendedComposition.notes: Kael'thas requires 4 tanks minimum for Phase 3 advisors. Bring multiple Mages for add control. Warlocks are essential for healthstones during the long Kael fight. Shamans for Bloodlust/Heroism timing on Phase 4.

minimumGear.tanks: 15,000+ health unbuffed, 490 Defense, SSC gear recommended
minimumGear.healers: 1,400+ healing power, 10,000+ mana, Fire Resistance gear helpful
minimumGear.dps: Full SSC gear or equivalent, flasks required for Kael progression

tempest_keep.tierTokens: Tier 5 Chest and Shoulders tokens drop here

bosses.name: Al'ar
bosses.description: The magnificent phoenix of Tempest Keep. Al'ar is a two-phase fight where the boss flies between elevated platforms in Phase 1, then rebirths in the center for Phase 2. The fight teaches basic TK mechanics like tank swaps and coordinated movement. Beautiful to witness when executed properly.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (Platform Phase): Al'ar flies between 4 upper platforms. Tanks must position on each platform and taunt when Al'ar lands. Raid handles adds and moves for Flame Quills.
Phase 2 (Ground Phase - 0% HP): Al'ar 'dies' and rebirths in the center with full HP. Standard tanking on the ground floor. Dodge Meteor dives and tank swap on Melt Armor.

platformLayout.description: Four elevated platforms connected by ramps. Al'ar spawns on Platform 1 and rotates clockwise.
platformLayout.positioning: Assign 2 tanks total - one on Platform 1 and 3 (opposite sides), one handles 2 and 4. Ranged DPS spreads on lower platforms/ramps.

abilities.name: Flame Buffet
abilities.description: Stacking debuff increasing Fire damage taken by 10% per stack. Applied every few seconds to anyone in melee range. Stacks persist for 10 seconds.
abilities.handling: Tank swap at 4-5 stacks. When Al'ar flies to a new platform, the current tank's stacks drop. This natural reset is part of the Phase 1 rhythm.

abilities.name: Flame Quills
abilities.description: Al'ar flies to the center of the room and shoots flames at ALL FOUR PLATFORMS simultaneously. Deals 8,000+ Fire damage per second to anyone on a platform. Lasts about 10 seconds.
abilities.handling: EVERYONE evacuate platforms and stand on ramps/center floor. This is announced by Al'ar flying to room center. Return to platforms after Quills ends. Missing this = instant death.

abilities.name: Ember Blast
abilities.description: When Al'ar transitions to a new platform, it spawns an Ember add at the previous location. Embers have ~25,000 HP and cast Ember Blast, a 2-second AoE dealing 8,000-10,000 Fire damage.
abilities.handling: Kill Embers FAST. Assign 2-3 ranged DPS to focus Embers. If they cast Ember Blast, it hurts. Alternatively, have a tank grab them and cleave down.

abilities.name: Rebirth
abilities.description: When Al'ar reaches 0% HP in Phase 1, it dies and immediately rebirths in the center of the room with full health. Phase 2 begins.
abilities.handling: All raid members move to the center floor. Tank picks up Al'ar facing away. This is NOT the end of the fight - you must kill Al'ar again in Phase 2.

abilities.name: Meteor
abilities.description: Phase 2 only. Al'ar flies into the air and dives at a random player's location, dealing 5,000-6,000 Fire damage split among everyone within 10 yards of impact.
abilities.handling: Stack loosely in groups of 4-5 players to split damage. Solo-soaking a Meteor is deadly. Spread slightly to avoid overlap with other mechanics, but close enough to share Meteor damage.

abilities.name: Melt Armor
abilities.description: Phase 2 only. Reduces the tank's armor by 80% for 60 seconds. This makes the tank take massive physical damage.
abilities.handling: IMMEDIATE tank swap when Melt Armor is applied. The debuffed tank should NOT have aggro. Use Shield Wall or other major cooldowns if you get caught with Melt Armor and aggro.

abilities.name: Charge
abilities.description: Phase 2 only. Al'ar charges a random player, dealing Fire damage and knockback.
abilities.handling: Healers be ready to top off charge targets. Not usually deadly but adds to the chaos.

bosses.strategy: PHASE 1: Two tanks alternate platforms. When Al'ar lands on your platform, taunt and tank facing away. When it moves, stay put - it'll come back. Kill Ember adds quickly. During Flame Quills (Al'ar flies to center), EVERYONE gets off platforms - stand on ramps or floor. Return after Quills ends. PHASE 2: Al'ar rebirths in center. Tank it on the floor, raid loosely stacks behind. Tank swap immediately when Melt Armor is applied. Spread slightly for Meteor but stay close enough to split damage. Pop Heroism/Bloodlust and burn. Phase 2 is simpler than Phase 1.
commonMistakes: Standing on platforms during Flame Quills - instant death
Not tank swapping on Melt Armor - tank gets crushed
Letting Ember adds free-cast - huge raid damage
Thinking Phase 1 death means the fight is over - Phase 2 is the real fight
Solo-soaking Meteor instead of stacking - likely death

bosses.name: Void Reaver
bosses.description: A massive Arcane Golem constructed by Kael'thas. Affectionately known as 'Loot Reaver' by the community because of how easy it is compared to other Tier 5 content. This fight serves as a gear check - if you can survive Pounding and avoid Arcane Orbs, you win. Many guilds kill Void Reaver before progressing through SSC.
phaseBreakdown: Single Phase: Tank and spank the entire fight. No phase transitions. Simply avoid orbs and heal through Pounding.

abilities.name: Pounding
abilities.description: Every 12-14 seconds, Void Reaver channels for 3 seconds, dealing 1,350-1,650 Arcane damage to the entire raid every second (4,000-5,000 total). This is unavoidable.
abilities.handling: Healers PRE-CAST AoE heals before Pounding ends. Chain Heal, Circle of Healing, Prayer of Healing. Everyone should be topped off before Pounding starts. If raid is low when Pounding begins, people will die.

abilities.name: Arcane Orb
abilities.description: Launches a slow-moving purple orb at a random player beyond 18 yards. The orb travels for several seconds, then EXPLODES for 6,000-7,000 Arcane damage to everyone within 20 yards of impact.
abilities.handling: SPREAD OUT 20+ yards apart. Watch for orbs coming your direction. If one is heading for you, MOVE. The orb is slow - you have time to react. If an orb lands in a clump of players, multiple people die.

abilities.name: Knock Away
abilities.description: Every 20-25 seconds, Void Reaver knocks the tank back and reduces their threat by 25%. This can cause aggro loss.
abilities.handling: Tank with your back against a wall to prevent knockback distance. Have an off-tank ready to taunt if the main tank loses aggro. Warriors should have an emergency taunt ready.

abilities.name: Melee Attacks
abilities.description: Void Reaver hits hard in melee - approximately 5,000-7,000 damage per swing on a geared tank.
abilities.handling: This is a tank gear check. Tanks need 15,000+ HP and good mitigation. Keep tank at high health to survive Pounding on top of melee.

bosses.strategy: POSITIONING: Tank pulls Void Reaver to a wall and tanks with back against it (prevents knockback). Ranged and healers spread out in a wide semicircle at 20-30 yard range, at least 20 yards apart from each other. Melee stack behind the boss. THE FIGHT: Pure tank and spank. Tank holds threat (watch for Knock Away aggro resets). Ranged watches for Arcane Orbs and moves out of the way. Healers pre-heal before Pounding ends. That's it. This is legitimately one of the easiest bosses in Tier 5, which is why guilds farm it early for shoulder tokens.
commonMistakes: Ranged not spreading out, causing Arcane Orb to hit multiple people
Not moving when an orb is clearly heading toward you
Tank not against a wall, getting knocked far and losing aggro
Healers not pre-casting heals, letting Pounding kill low-HP players
Underestimating the fight and bringing undergeared tanks
lootHighlights: Pauldrons of the Vanquished Champion/Defender/Hero (Tier 5 Shoulders)

bosses.name: High Astromancer Solarian
bosses.description: A Blood Elf astromancer who calls upon the power of the stars and eventually transforms into a voidwalker. The infamous 'bomb' mechanic tests your raid's awareness - one person not running out can wipe the entire group. Also features split phases where Solarian disappears and adds spawn.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (100%-20% HP): Solarian cycles between attacking and disappearing to spawn adds. Bomb mechanic is active.
Split Phase: Every 50 seconds, Solarian vanishes and spawns adds in a specific location. Kill adds, she returns.
