Phase 2 (20%-0% HP): Solarian transforms into a Voidwalker. No more bombs, just burn her down.

abilities.name: Arcane Missiles
abilities.description: Channels a barrage of Arcane Missiles at the tank, dealing 2,500-3,500 damage per missile (5-6 missiles total).
abilities.handling: Tank damage is moderate but consistent. Healers should maintain steady healing on the tank. Not particularly dangerous if tank is geared.

abilities.name: Wrath of the Astromancer
abilities.description: Marks a random player as a LIVING BOMB. After 6 seconds, they explode for 5,400-6,600 Arcane damage to everyone within 10 yards. The bomb player takes moderate damage as well.
abilities.handling: THE MOST IMPORTANT MECHANIC. If you get the bomb debuff, RUN AWAY FROM EVERYONE immediately. Get at least 15 yards from any other player. Do NOT run toward the healers. If you explode near the raid, you likely wipe. Watch your debuffs!

abilities.name: Blinding Light
abilities.description: AoE knockback and 2,500-3,500 Arcane damage to everyone within 20 yards. Also disorients for 2 seconds.
abilities.handling: Melee should expect to be knocked back and disoriented. Run back in after it fades. Tanks should be positioned to avoid getting knocked away from the boss.

abilities.name: Split Phase - Adds
abilities.description: Every 50 seconds, Solarian teleports to a random room location, goes immune, and spawns 4 Solarium Agents (weak casters) and 2 Solarium Priests (healers that buff Agents).
abilities.handling: Kill Agents first - they cast Arcane damage on the raid. Then kill Priests. The Agents will gain Blessing of Might from Priests if you let Priests live. AoE damage works well. Solarian returns after 15-20 seconds.

abilities.name: Solarium Agent
abilities.description: Weak caster adds spawning during Split Phase. Cast Arcane spells at random targets.
abilities.handling: Kill quickly with AoE. Low HP but annoying if left alive.

abilities.name: Solarium Priest
abilities.description: Healer adds spawning during Split Phase. Cast Greater Heal on Agents and buff them with Blessing of Might.
abilities.handling: Lower priority than Agents but should die second. Interrupt heals if possible.

abilities.name: Void Form
abilities.description: At 20% HP, Solarian permanently transforms into a Voidwalker. She gains: Void Bolt (6,000 Shadow damage nuke), and Psychic Scream (AoE fear). No more bombs or split phases.
abilities.handling: Pop Heroism/Bloodlust and burn. Tank faces her away. Tremor Totems and Fear Ward help with Psychic Scream. This phase is simple - just avoid the fear and kill her.

bosses.strategy: POSITIONING: Tank Solarian in the center of the room. Raid spreads loosely around her - at least 10 yards between players for bomb explosions. Mark a 'bomb spot' far from the raid where bomb targets should run. PHASE 1: Tank and spank until bomb. When you get bomb, IMMEDIATELY run to the designated safe spot. During Split Phase (she vanishes), group up and AoE the adds - Agents first, then Priests. Return to spread positions when she comes back. PHASE 2 (Void Form at 20%): Pop cooldowns, group up for cleave/AoE heals, burn her down. Fear management with Tremor Totems helps. Simple burn phase.
commonMistakes: Not running out when you get bomb - wipes the melee or healers
Running the wrong direction with bomb - toward healers instead of away
Not spreading out enough during Phase 1
Ignoring adds during Split Phase, causing them to overwhelm healers
Panicking during Void Form fear instead of using Tremor/Fear Ward
lootHighlights: Leggings of the Vanquished Champion/Defender/Hero (Tier 5 Legs)

bosses.name: Kael'thas Sunstrider
bosses.description: The Lord of the Blood Elves and the most complex encounter in The Burning Crusade. This 5-phase, 15-20 minute fight is legendary for its difficulty and is considered by many to be the hardest boss in TBC. The fight features four advisors, seven legendary weapons, and the famous Gravity Lapse mechanic. Guilds spend weeks learning this encounter. Prepare for many, many wipes.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (Advisors): Four advisors engage one at a time with 10-second gaps. Kill each before the next activates. ~3 minutes.
Phase 2 (Weapons): Seven legendary weapons animate and attack. Kill and LOOT them - they provide crucial buffs for later phases. ~2 minutes.
Phase 3 (Advisors Resurrected): ALL FOUR advisors resurrect at once. Kill them again while using your new weapons. ~2-3 minutes.
Phase 4 (Kael'thas Active): Kael'thas himself joins the fight. Manage Phoenixes, Mind Control, and high tank damage. ~5-6 minutes.
Phase 5 (Gravity Lapse - 50% HP): Everyone floats in the air. Avoid Nether Vapor orbs while DPSing Kael'thas. Cycles between flight and ground phases until dead.

advisors.name: Thaladred the Darkener (First)
advisors.abilities: Gaze: Fixates on a random player and chases them. Silence: AoE silence around him. Psychic Blow: Huge knockback on current target.
advisors.strategy: KITE HIM. Whoever gets Gaze runs away while ranged DPS kills him. He cannot be tanked traditionally. Stay spread to avoid Silence hitting multiple people.

advisors.name: Lord Sanguinar (Second)
advisors.abilities: Bellowing Roar: AoE fear. Standard melee attacks.
advisors.strategy: Normal tanking. Use Tremor Totem and Fear Ward for fear. Simple tank and spank compared to Thaladred.

advisors.name: Grand Astromancer Capernian (Third)
advisors.abilities: Fireball: 5,500-6,500 Fire damage. Conflagration: AoE 6,000+ Fire damage + DoT. Arcane Burst: 10,000+ damage if anyone is within 10 yards.
advisors.strategy: RANGED ONLY TANK. A Mage or Warlock tanks her at max range. She cannot be approached in melee due to Arcane Burst. Interrupt Fireballs if possible.

advisors.name: Master Engineer Telonicus (Fourth)
advisors.abilities: Bomb: Stuns target for 4 seconds. Remote Toy: Spawns robots that must be killed.
advisors.strategy: Normal tanking. Kill robots when they spawn. Watch for Bomb stuns on tanks - off-tank should be ready.

legendaryWeapons.name: Staff of Disintegration
legendaryWeapons.effect: +200% melee damage, reduces threat. CRITICAL for Phase 3+ DPS.

legendaryWeapons.name: Phaseshift Bulwark
legendaryWeapons.effect: Absorb shield on use. CRITICAL for Phase 5.

abilities.name: Fireball
abilities.description: Standard 3-second cast dealing 15,000-20,000 Fire damage to the tank. Cast frequently.
abilities.handling: Tank needs to stay topped off at all times. Fire Resistance Aura and Fire protection potions help. Interruptible but Kael'thas has fast cast recovery.

abilities.name: Flamestrike
abilities.description: Places a Flamestrike on a random player's location. Deals 6,000-8,000 initial Fire damage plus 3,000/sec for 8 seconds in the zone.
abilities.handling: MOVE OUT of the red circle immediately. These zones persist and restrict movement space over time.

abilities.name: Phoenix
abilities.description: Summons a Phoenix add that leaves a trail of fire as it moves. When killed, it drops an egg. If the egg is not destroyed in 15 seconds, the Phoenix respawns.
abilities.handling: Assign a tank to kite the Phoenix away from the raid. Ranged DPS kills it, then IMMEDIATELY kills the egg. Missing an egg means dealing with another Phoenix.

abilities.name: Mind Control
abilities.description: Mind Controls a random player. The MC'd player gains 30% increased damage and can attack allies.
abilities.handling: CC the MC'd player with Polymorph, Fear, or other control. Do NOT kill them. The MC breaks after ~30 seconds or can be broken by the Staff of Disintegration weapon.

abilities.name: Shock Barrier
abilities.description: At set intervals, Kael'thas shields himself (100,000 damage absorb) and begins casting Pyroblast (10,000-12,000 Fire damage). If Pyroblast completes, someone dies.
abilities.handling: ALL DPS must STOP EVERYTHING and burn the Shock Barrier immediately. Breaking the barrier interrupts Pyroblast. This is a DPS check - failing means death.

abilities.name: Gravity Lapse
abilities.description: Phase 5: Everyone is lifted into the air and can 'swim' in 3D space. Nether Vapor orbs spawn and deal 2,000 Shadow damage on contact. Lasts 30 seconds, then drops everyone to the ground.
abilities.handling: USE YOUR PHASESHIFT BULWARK before you hit the ground to absorb fall damage. While flying, avoid all orbs - they spawn from Kael'thas and drift toward players. Stay spread, keep DPSing. After landing, normal combat resumes until next Gravity Lapse.

abilities.name: Nether Vapor
abilities.description: Small purple orbs that spawn during Gravity Lapse. Each orb deals 2,000 Shadow damage and reduces max HP by 10% for 30 seconds on contact.
abilities.handling: AVOID ALL ORBS. The HP reduction stacks. Touching 3-4 orbs means you die when Gravity Lapse ends. Navigate carefully - they move slowly.

abilities.name: Nether Beam
abilities.description: During Gravity Lapse, Kael'thas fires Shadow beams at random players for 3,000 damage.
abilities.handling: Healers continue healing during Gravity Lapse. This is unavoidable damage.

bosses.strategy: PHASE 1: Kill advisors in order - Thaladred (kite), Sanguinar (tank), Capernian (ranged tank), Telonicus (tank). 10 seconds between each activation. PHASE 2: Kill all 7 weapons and LOOT THEM. Assign weapons before pull. Staff goes to Warlock, Bow to Hunter, etc. PHASE 3: All 4 advisors resurrect. CC Capernian immediately (Polymorph). Kill Thaladred first (still kite), then Sanguinar, then Telonicus, then Capernian. PHASE 4: Kael'thas is active. Tank and spank. Off-tank kites Phoenix, DPS kills Phoenix and egg. CC Mind Controlled players. When Shock Barrier appears, ALL DPS switches and breaks it before Pyroblast. PHASE 5 (50% HP): Gravity Lapse cycles. When flying, avoid orbs, DPS Kael'thas. Before landing, USE PHASESHIFT BULWARK. Ground phase resumes until next Gravity Lapse. Repeat until dead. Pop Heroism during a ground phase below 30%.
commonMistakes: Not looting weapons in Phase 2 - massive DPS and utility loss
Not using Phaseshift Bulwark before landing during Gravity Lapse - death
Failing to break Shock Barrier in time - Pyroblast kills someone
Letting Phoenix eggs hatch - doubled Phoenix problems
Standing near Capernian in Phase 3 - Arcane Burst kills melee
Touching multiple Nether Vapor orbs - HP reduction stacks = death
lootHighlights: Chestguard of the Vanquished Champion/Defender/Hero (Tier 5 Chest)
Ashes of Al'ar (from Al'ar, not Kael'thas)

phase3.name: Phase 3: Tier 6 Content
phase3.description: The third raiding tier features Mount Hyjal and Black Temple, home to Illidan Stormrage. These raids represent the pinnacle of TBC raiding before Sunwell.

mount_hyjal.name: The Battle for Mount Hyjal
mount_hyjal.attunement: Vials of Eternity (requires killing Vashj and Kael'thas)
mount_hyjal.description: A unique wave-defense raid set during the Battle of Mount Hyjal from Warcraft III. You'll fight alongside Jaina Proudmoore and Thrall to defend their bases against waves of Scourge and Burning Legion forces. Each boss is preceded by 8 waves of trash - wipe on trash and you restart from wave 1. This raid is more about endurance and AoE than traditional boss mechanics.

recommendedComposition.notes: Heavy AoE damage dealers (Warlocks, Mages) are essential for trash waves. Bring Shadow Priests for mana return on Kaz'rogal. Ensure multiple Fear Ward/Tremor Totems for Archimonde.

minimumGear.tanks: 16,000+ health unbuffed, full SSC/TK gear, Shadow Resistance set for Archimonde
minimumGear.healers: 1,600+ healing power, 11,000+ mana, Arcane Resistance pieces helpful
minimumGear.dps: Full Tier 5 or equivalent. Archmonde requires flasks and consumables.

mount_hyjal.trashWaveInfo: Each boss is preceded by 8 waves of trash. Waves spawn every 2 minutes. If you wipe on ANY wave, you restart from wave 1. Jaina/Thrall's NPCs help tank and damage but can die. Managing mana and cooldowns across all 8 waves is critical.
mount_hyjal.tierTokens: Tier 6 Gloves and Helm tokens drop here

bosses.name: Rage Winterchill
bosses.description: A powerful Lich commanding the first assault on the Alliance base. After surviving 8 waves of Ghouls, Crypt Fiends, Abominations, Necromancers, and Banshees, Winterchill himself attacks. This is primarily a healing and positioning check.
phaseBreakdown: Single Phase: Tank and spank with movement for Death and Decay. Spread for Icebolt. Heal through consistent Frost damage.

abilities.name: Icebolt
abilities.description: Fires a bolt at a random player dealing 4,250-5,750 Frost damage and encasing them in ice for 4 seconds. The player cannot move, attack, or be healed while frozen.
abilities.handling: Spread out so Icebolt only hits one person. Healers must top off the frozen player IMMEDIATELY when they break out - they'll be at reduced health. This is unavoidable raid damage that tests healer reactions.

abilities.name: Frost Nova
abilities.description: AoE Frost spell around Winterchill dealing 2,500-3,500 Frost damage and rooting all players within 15 yards for 4 seconds.
abilities.handling: Melee must be ready to get rooted. Use trinkets or simply wait it out. Don't panic - the root breaks after 4 seconds. Healers keep melee alive during root.

abilities.name: Frost Armor
abilities.description: Passive buff on Winterchill. Melee attackers have a chance to be slowed by 30% and take minor Frost damage.
abilities.handling: This cannot be removed or avoided. Melee just deal with the slow. It's annoying but not dangerous.

abilities.name: Death and Decay
abilities.description: Places a large green zone on the ground lasting 15 seconds. Standing in it deals 2,500 Shadow damage per second - rapidly fatal.
abilities.handling: MOVE OUT IMMEDIATELY when you see the green circle. The zone is large but stationary. The boss will continue casting this throughout the fight, eventually limiting available space.

bosses.strategy: TRASH WAVES: AoE down each wave efficiently. Mages Blizzard, Warlocks Seed of Corruption, Warriors Whirlwind. Save cooldowns for Abomination waves. BOSS: Tank Winterchill near Jaina's base with raid spread behind. When Death and Decay drops, move as a group. Healers react quickly to Icebolt victims when they break free. Keep melee alive through Frost Nova roots. Simple fight if you survived the trash.
commonMistakes: Standing in Death and Decay - rapid death
Not healing Icebolt victims immediately after they break free
Running out of mana on trash waves before the boss spawns
Clumping up and having multiple people frozen by Icebolt

bosses.name: Anetheron
bosses.description: A Nathrezim Dreadlord leading the second assault on the Alliance base. His Infernal summons and Vampiric Aura healing make this a DPS race with heavy add management. The infamous Carrion Swarm can devastate poorly positioned raids.
phaseBreakdown: Single Phase: Tank and spank while managing Infernal adds. DPS must overcome Vampiric Aura healing.

abilities.name: Carrion Swarm
abilities.description: Frontal cone attack dealing 4,500-6,500 Shadow damage and reducing all healing received by 75% for 20 seconds. Hits everyone in a wide cone in front of the boss.
abilities.handling: ONLY THE TANK should be in front of Anetheron. If Carrion Swarm hits the raid, healing is nearly impossible for 20 seconds. Position boss facing away with raid behind. Dispel the healing reduction immediately - it's a Magic debuff.

abilities.name: Sleep
abilities.description: Puts up to 3 random targets to sleep for 10 seconds. Any damage breaks the sleep.
abilities.handling: Healers should be assigned to dispel Sleep quickly, especially if it hits tanks. DPS can break each other out with minor damage. Not deadly but annoying.

abilities.name: Inferno
abilities.description: Calls down an Infernal meteor at a random player's location every 45 seconds. The impact deals 2,500-3,500 Fire damage in a radius. The Infernal persists as an add with 500,000 HP and moderate melee damage.
abilities.handling: Move away from the impact zone (red circle on ground). Off-tanks must pick up Infernals immediately - they can wreck healers if loose. Kite or tank Infernals away from the raid. Most guilds ignore them and burn the boss.

abilities.name: Vampiric Aura
abilities.description: Passive aura healing Anetheron for 300% of all melee damage he deals. This creates a constant stream of self-healing.
abilities.handling: This is why the fight is a DPS race. Your raid DPS must significantly exceed his healing. Focus all damage on Anetheron and ignore Infernals if your DPS is high enough. Pop Heroism/Bloodlust early.

bosses.strategy: POSITIONING: Tank Anetheron facing AWAY from the raid at all times. Never let Carrion Swarm hit anyone except the tank. ADDS: Off-tanks pick up Infernals as they spawn. Either kite them forever or tank them away from raid. Most guilds ignore them and DPS race the boss. DPS RACE: Vampiric Aura heals him constantly. Pop cooldowns early and burn. Dispel Sleep and Carrion Swarm debuffs immediately.
commonMistakes: Carrion Swarm hitting the raid - healing reduction is devastating
Not picking up Infernals, letting them kill healers
DPS too low to overcome Vampiric Aura healing
Not dispelling Sleep from tanks

bosses.name: Kaz'rogal
bosses.description: A massive Doom Guard leading the assault on the Horde base. His infamous Mark of Kaz'rogal drains mana - if you hit 0 mana, you EXPLODE and deal massive damage to nearby allies. This fight is a mana management nightmare for casters and healers.
phaseBreakdown: Single Phase: Tank and spank while managing mana drain. Players running low on mana must run out before exploding.

abilities.name: Cleave
abilities.description: Frontal cleave dealing 7,000-9,000 Physical damage to everyone in front of the boss.
abilities.handling: ONLY the tank should be in front. Standard melee positioning - all DPS behind the boss.

abilities.name: War Stomp
abilities.description: AoE attack dealing 2,000-3,000 Physical damage and stunning everyone within 15 yards for 5 seconds.
abilities.handling: Melee will get stunned frequently. Healers should NOT all be in stomp range - spread healers so at least some can heal during stuns. The stun is short but dangerous if the tank is low.

abilities.name: Mark of Kaz'rogal
abilities.description: Every 45 seconds, drains 600 mana per second from ALL players for 5 seconds (3,000 total mana drained). If ANY player reaches 0 mana, they EXPLODE dealing 10,000 Shadow damage to everyone within 15 yards.
abilities.handling: THIS IS THE FIGHT. Mana users MUST manage their mana carefully. Use Mana Potions, Dark Runes, and mana cooldowns (Innervate, Mana Tide) during Mark. If you're about to hit 0 mana, RUN AWAY from the raid IMMEDIATELY before you explode. Shadow Priests with Vampiric Touch are incredible here.

bosses.strategy: POSITIONING: Tank faces boss away. Melee behind boss. Healers and casters spread out 15+ yards from each other (so explosions don't chain). MANA MANAGEMENT: Before each Mark of Kaz'rogal, check your mana. Use consumables during the drain. If you're going to bottom out, RUN OUT of the raid before you explode. Warlocks can Life Tap to avoid explosion (0 mana but not dead = no explosion). KILL PRIORITY: Non-mana DPS (Rogues, Hunters) are critical for this fight since they can't explode.
commonMistakes: Casters/healers exploding in the middle of the raid
Not using mana consumables during Mark
Healers all getting stunned by War Stomp at the same time
Running out of mana on trash waves before the boss

bosses.name: Azgalor
bosses.description: A Pit Lord commanding the final Horde base assault. His Doom ability guarantees player deaths and spawns dangerous adds. The AoE silence from Howl combined with Rain of Fire creates deadly windows where healing is impossible.
phaseBreakdown: Single Phase: Tank and spank with guaranteed deaths from Doom. Off-tanks handle Lesser Doomguard adds.

abilities.name: Cleave
abilities.description: Massive frontal cleave dealing 8,000-12,000 Physical damage to everyone in front.
abilities.handling: Only the tank in front. This cleave HURTS - it can two-shot non-tanks.

abilities.name: Rain of Fire
abilities.description: Places a Rain of Fire at a random location dealing 2,000-3,000 Fire damage per second to anyone inside. Multiple can be active at once.
abilities.handling: MOVE OUT of fire immediately. Watch your feet - the visual can be subtle. As the fight goes on, available space becomes limited.

abilities.name: Howl of Azgalor
abilities.description: Every 15-20 seconds, Azgalor howls, silencing the ENTIRE RAID for 5 seconds. No exceptions.
abilities.handling: Healers MUST pre-HoT the tank before Howl. During the 5-second silence, no one can cast anything. If the tank is low when Howl hits, they may die. Plan around the silence windows.

abilities.name: Doom
abilities.description: Marks a random player with Doom. After 20 seconds, they DIE (unavoidable). When they die, a Lesser Doomguard add spawns at their corpse.
abilities.handling: Doom CANNOT be prevented, dispelled, or immuned. The target WILL die. Warlocks should Soulstone Doomed healers. Druids can Combat Res. The Doomed player should move away from the raid before dying. Off-tank picks up the Lesser Doomguard immediately.

abilities.name: Lesser Doomguard (Add)
abilities.description: Spawns when a Doomed player dies. Has moderate health and hits hard. Casts War Stomp (AoE stun).
abilities.handling: Off-tanks MUST grab these immediately. Tank them away from the raid. Kill them when possible but they're not the priority - boss is.

bosses.strategy: PREPARATION: Warlocks prepare Soulstones for healers. Druids save Combat Res. Mark off-tanks for add duty. POSITIONING: Tank faces boss away. Raid spreads loosely behind. DOOM: When someone gets Doom, they should move to a designated spot away from raid before dying. Off-tank picks up the add. Soulstone/Combat Res as needed. HOWL: Healers pre-HoT the tank before every Howl. The 5-second silence is predictable - plan around it. FIRE: Move out of Rain of Fire immediately.
commonMistakes: Doomed players dying in the middle of the raid, add spawns on healers
Not pre-HoTting tank before Howl, tank dies during silence
Standing in Rain of Fire
Not having off-tanks ready for Lesser Doomguard adds

bosses.name: Archimonde
bosses.description: The Defiler, lord of the Burning Legion's invasion force. Archimonde is one of the most punishing fights in TBC - a single mistake can wipe the raid. The fight demands perfect execution of Air Burst (using Tears), Doomfire kiting, and fear management. Every player death brings the raid closer to a wipe through Soul Charge.
phaseBreakdown: Single Phase: Constant execution test. Manage Air Burst with Tears of the Goddess, kite Doomfire, avoid spreading Grip of the Legion, don't get feared into fire, and above all - DON'T DIE.

specialItem.name: Tears of the Goddess
specialItem.description: Every player receives this item from Tyrande before the fight. Using it gives a 2-minute slow fall effect. YOU MUST USE IT WHEN AIR BURSTED OR YOU DIE.

abilities.name: Air Burst
abilities.description: Targets a random player and launches them extremely high into the air. Without slow fall, the fall damage is instantly fatal.
abilities.handling: THE MOMENT you start flying upward, USE TEARS OF THE GODDESS. You have about 1 second to react. Create a macro and spam it. If you don't use Tears, you splat and die. Practice this reaction.

abilities.name: Grip of the Legion
abilities.description: Places a DoT on a random player dealing 2,500 Shadow damage every 2 seconds. The DoT JUMPS to anyone within 10 yards, spreading infinitely.
abilities.handling: SPREAD OUT 15 yards minimum from other players. If you get Grip, DO NOT run toward others. Dispel it immediately - it's a Magic debuff. If multiple people have Grip, they must separate before dispelling or it just re-spreads.

abilities.name: Doomfire
abilities.description: Spawns a fire elemental that chases a random player. The elemental leaves a trail of Doomfire on the ground that persists and deals 2,500 Fire damage per second to anyone standing in it.
abilities.handling: If you're being chased by Doomfire, KITE IT AWAY from the raid. Run in wide arcs around the edge of the battlefield. The fire trail persists for 2 minutes, slowly filling the area with deadly ground. Do NOT kite it through the raid.

abilities.name: Fear
abilities.description: Every 40 seconds, Archimonde casts an AoE fear affecting everyone within 30 yards. Lasts 8 seconds.
abilities.handling: Tremor Totems are MANDATORY - drop them constantly. Fear Ward on tanks. Warriors use Berserker Rage. Undead use Will of the Forsaken. If you get feared into Doomfire, you die. Position yourself so fear paths don't cross fire.

abilities.name: Soul Charge
abilities.description: Every time a player DIES, Archimonde gains a Soul Charge. When he has Soul Charges, he periodically unleashes them as massive AoE damage (based on the dead player's class).
abilities.handling: DO NOT DIE. Every death gives Archimonde power to wipe the raid. At 3-4 deaths, the Soul Charge explosions become unhealable. Prevent deaths at all costs.

abilities.name: Finger of Death
abilities.description: If no one is in melee range of Archimonde, he casts Finger of Death, instantly killing a random player.
abilities.handling: The tank must ALWAYS be in melee range. If the tank dies or gets feared away with no one to cover, Archimonde starts one-shotting people. Have off-tanks ready.

bosses.strategy: SETUP: Everyone equips Tears of the Goddess macro on an easy keybind. Spread out in a WIDE semicircle at least 15 yards apart. Tremor Totems placed throughout. EXECUTION: React instantly to Air Burst with Tears. If you get Doomfire, kite it to the edges - NEVER through the raid. Don't spread Grip of the Legion. Break fears with totems/abilities. Keep someone in melee range at ALL TIMES. MOST IMPORTANTLY: Don't die. Soul Charge snowballs - 3 deaths usually means wipe. Execute perfectly and Archimonde dies. One mistake and the raid dies.
commonMistakes: Not using Tears of the Goddess when Air Bursted - instant death
Kiting Doomfire through the raid instead of around the edges
Standing too close to others, spreading Grip of the Legion
Getting feared into Doomfire
Tank leaving melee range, triggering Finger of Death
Accumulating Soul Charges from player deaths

black_temple.name: Black Temple
black_temple.attunement: Medallion of Karabor (requires extensive questline through Shadowmoon Valley, SSC, and TK)
black_temple.description: The fortress of Illidan Stormrage and the most iconic raid in The Burning Crusade. Black Temple features 9 challenging bosses culminating in the legendary battle against Illidan himself. This raid drops the coveted Warglaives of Azzinoth and is where guilds prove their mastery of TBC raiding.

recommendedComposition.notes: Shadow Resistance gear required for Mother Shahraz. Warlock tank useful for Illidan. Multiple interrupters needed for Council. Fire Resistance helpful for Illidan demon phases.

minimumGear.tanks: 17,000+ health unbuffed, full Tier 5/Hyjal gear, 365 Shadow Resistance (buffed) for Mother Shahraz
minimumGear.healers: 1,800+ healing power, 11,000+ mana, Shadow Resistance set for Shahraz
minimumGear.dps: Full Tier 5/6 mix. Fire Resistance gear (150+) recommended for Illidan Phase 2.

black_temple.tierTokens: Tier 6 Chest, Legs, Shoulders, Bracers, Belt, and Boots tokens drop here

bosses.name: High Warlord Naj'entus
bosses.description: A massive Naga sea giant and the first boss of Black Temple. The fight revolves around the Tidal Shield mechanic - when he shields himself, a raid member must loot and throw a spine to break it before catastrophic raid damage.
phaseBreakdown: Single Phase: Tank and spank with periodic Tidal Shield. When shield appears, designated player throws looted spine to break it before Tidal Burst.

abilities.name: Needle Spine
abilities.description: Shoots spines at random raid members dealing 3,000-4,000 Physical damage. Also applies a 2,000 damage DoT that deals 2,000 Frost damage per tick.
abilities.handling: Constant raid damage that must be healed through. Keep the raid topped off at all times - Tidal Burst is coming.

abilities.name: Impaling Spine
abilities.description: Impales a random player with a large spine, rooting them and dealing 4,500 damage plus 2,750 damage every 3 seconds until removed. After 30 seconds, the spine despawns and can be looted.
abilities.handling: Heavy heal the impaled player - they take significant damage. When the spine despawns (drops on ground), the player can loot it. THIS SPINE IS NEEDED to break Tidal Shield.

abilities.name: Tidal Shield
abilities.description: Naj'entus shields himself with 100% damage immunity. While shielded, he charges Tidal Burst. Shield has ~8 seconds before Tidal Burst.
abilities.handling: A player with a looted Impaling Spine MUST throw it at Naj'entus to break the shield. Assign players to hold spines specifically for this purpose.

abilities.name: Tidal Burst
abilities.description: When Tidal Shield breaks (or times out), deals 8,500 Frost damage to the entire raid. This is unavoidable even with perfect play.
abilities.handling: Everyone must be near full health before this hits. AoE healing cooldowns (Prayer of Healing, Chain Heal spam) immediately after. If the shield wasn't broken fast enough, the damage is higher.

bosses.strategy: POSITIONING: Tank Naj'entus at the bottom of the ramp. Raid spreads loosely behind. SPINE ROTATION: Assign 2-3 players as 'spine holders'. When Impaling Spine hits them, they loot it after it despawns and hold it. When Tidal Shield appears, a spine holder IMMEDIATELY throws their spine at the boss. HEALING: Keep raid above 85% health at all times. Tidal Burst WILL hit - be ready with AoE heals. The fight is a healing throughput check.
commonMistakes: Not having a spine ready when Tidal Shield appears
Raid not topped off before Tidal Burst
Impaled players not looting their spines
Healers not pre-casting AoE heals for Tidal Burst

bosses.name: Supremus
bosses.description: A colossal Abyssal patrolling the temple grounds. Supremus alternates between a tank phase (Hateful Strike soaking) and a kite phase (random fixation). This is one of the simpler bosses in BT despite his intimidating size.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (Tank Phase - 60 seconds): Standard tanking with Hateful Strike. Multiple tanks soak the strike.
Phase 2 (Kite Phase - 60 seconds): Supremus fixates on random players who must kite him while avoiding ground fires.
Cycle: Alternates between phases until dead.

abilities.name: Hateful Strike
abilities.description: Every 2 seconds, Supremus hits the raid member with the HIGHEST HEALTH within melee range for 20,000-30,000 Physical damage. Always targets highest HP, not highest threat.
abilities.handling: Stack 3-4 tanks in melee range. Healers keep them ALL topped off so the damage rotates between them. If only one tank is high HP, they take every strike and die.

abilities.name: Molten Punch
abilities.description: Creates a line of fire on the ground that persists and deals heavy Fire damage to anyone standing in it.
abilities.handling: Simply don't stand in fire. Watch your feet during Phase 1.

abilities.name: Volcanic Geyser
abilities.description: Phase 2 only. Blue flame volcanoes spawn under random players, dealing Fire damage and knocking them back.
abilities.handling: Keep moving during Phase 2. Standing still spawns geysers under you. Constant movement prevents damage.

abilities.name: Gaze (Fixate)
abilities.description: Phase 2 only. Supremus fixates on a random player and chases them for 10 seconds. He moves slowly but kills anyone he reaches.
abilities.handling: If you get Gaze, RUN AWAY. Kite him around the courtyard. He's slow - just keep moving. After 10 seconds, he picks a new target.

abilities.name: Molten Flame
abilities.description: Phase 2 only. Supremus leaves a trail of fire as he chases his Gaze target.
abilities.handling: Don't run through his fire trail. Kite in wide arcs, not circles.

bosses.strategy: PHASE 1: 3-4 tanks stack in melee range. Healers keep ALL tanks topped off - Hateful Strike always hits highest HP. Melee DPS behind the boss. Avoid fire lines. PHASE 2: Everyone spreads out and keeps moving. When Supremus Gazes you, kite him in wide arcs. Don't stand still or geysers spawn under you. Continue DPS while moving. After 60 seconds, return to Phase 1 positions. REPEAT until dead.
commonMistakes: Only one tank in melee during Phase 1 - they die
Standing still during Phase 2 - geysers spawn
Kiting Gaze through the raid - fire trail kills people
Running straight away from Gaze instead of wide arcs

bosses.name: Shade of Akama
bosses.description: Akama, the Broken elder, must free himself from his corrupted shade. This is an add-management fight where you defend Akama while he channels to break free. If Akama dies, you wipe.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (Add Phase): Endless waves of Ashtongue adds spawn. Kill them while Akama channels toward the Shade.
Phase 2 (Burn Phase): When Akama reaches the Shade, all remaining adds despawn. Burn the Shade down.

abilities.name: Ashtongue Channeler
abilities.description: 6 Channelers surround the Shade, keeping it immune. They channel until killed.
abilities.handling: Kill all 6 Channelers FIRST before engaging the Shade. They don't fight back - just focus them down to start the encounter.

abilities.name: Ashtongue Defender
abilities.description: Melee adds that spawn from the sides. They attack Akama, not the raid.
abilities.handling: Tanks pick these up and hold them off Akama. Don't let them hit Akama or he dies.

abilities.name: Ashtongue Elementalist
abilities.description: Caster adds that spawn. Cast Rain of Fire and Frost Shock.
abilities.handling: Interrupt Rain of Fire - it does heavy damage. Kill these quickly.

abilities.name: Ashtongue Rogue
abilities.description: Stealthed adds that spawn and attack random raid members with Debilitating Poison.
abilities.handling: AoE to break stealth. Dispel the poison.

abilities.name: Ashtongue Spiritbinder
abilities.description: Healer adds that spawn. Cast Chain Heal on other adds and Spirit Mend on the Shade.
abilities.handling: KILL THESE FIRST or interrupt their heals. Top priority adds.

bosses.strategy: SETUP: Kill the 6 Channelers to start the encounter. Akama begins walking toward the Shade. ADD MANAGEMENT: Tanks position at add spawn points. Kill order: Spiritbinders > Elementalists > Rogues > Defenders. Protect Akama at all costs. PHASE 2: When Akama reaches the Shade, remaining adds despawn. Pop cooldowns and burn the Shade. It has moderate health and goes down fast if adds are managed properly.
commonMistakes: Letting adds reach Akama - he dies, you wipe
Not interrupting Spiritbinder heals - fight takes forever
Ignoring Elementalist Rain of Fire
Not having tanks ready at spawn points

bosses.name: Teron Gorefiend
bosses.description: The first Death Knight of the Horde, raised by Gul'dan. This fight features a unique mechanic: players marked with Shadow of Death will die and become ghosts. As ghosts, they must use special abilities to kill Shadowy Constructs before they reach the raid. One failed ghost player can wipe the entire raid.

ghostAbilities.description: When you die from Shadow of Death, you become a ghost for 60 seconds with 4 abilities:
abilities: Spirit Lance (1): Deals 15,000 damage. Use on cooldown.
Spirit Chains (2): Roots a Construct for 5 seconds. Use to control adds.
Spirit Shield (3): Absorbs 50,000 damage for 30 seconds. Use on raid members.
Spirit Volley (4): AoE damage. Use when multiple Constructs are stacked.
ghostAbilities.practice: IMPORTANT: Practice the ghost minigame at htttps://www.yourgamercards.net/teron/ before attempting this boss!

abilities.name: Shadow of Death
abilities.description: Marks a random player. After 55 seconds, they DIE and become a ghost. They then control their ghost form for 60 seconds.
abilities.handling: When you get Shadow of Death, mentally prepare. In 55 seconds you will die and become a ghost. As a ghost, you MUST kill the Shadowy Constructs that spawn. If constructs reach the raid, people die.

abilities.name: Shadowy Constructs
abilities.description: When a player dies from Shadow of Death, 4 Shadowy Constructs spawn at their corpse. These constructs walk toward the raid and one-shot anyone they touch.
abilities.handling: GHOST PLAYERS must kill these using their ghost abilities. Use Spirit Lance for damage, Spirit Chains to root them, Spirit Volley for AoE. If constructs reach the raid, multiple people die.

abilities.name: Incinerate
abilities.description: Deals 3,000-5,000 Fire damage to a random player.
abilities.handling: Random damage that healers must react to. Keep raid topped off.

abilities.name: Crushing Shadows
abilities.description: Debuff increasing Shadow damage taken by 60% for 15 seconds.
abilities.handling: DISPEL IMMEDIATELY. Players with this debuff take much more damage from Doom Blossom.

abilities.name: Doom Blossom
abilities.description: Spawns shadow flowers around the room that shoot Shadow Bolt at random players for 750 Shadow damage each.
abilities.handling: Move away from flowers. The bolts hurt, especially with Crushing Shadows debuff.

bosses.strategy: PREPARATION: Everyone should practice the ghost minigame before raiding. POSITIONING: Tank Gorefiend in the center. Raid spreads loosely. EXECUTION: Tank and spank normally. When you get Shadow of Death, move to a designated 'death spot' away from the raid. When you die and become a ghost, IMMEDIATELY start killing Shadowy Constructs using your ghost abilities. Root them with Chains, damage with Lance and Volley. Do NOT let constructs reach living players. After 60 seconds of ghost form, you resurrect. REPEAT until boss dies.
commonMistakes: Not practicing the ghost minigame - players fail their ghost phase
Ghost players letting constructs reach the raid
Not dispelling Crushing Shadows
Dying in the middle of the raid instead of a designated spot

bosses.name: Gurtogg Bloodboil
bosses.description: A massive Fel Orc warlock. This fight requires precise positioning with three raid groups rotating to soak Bloodboil stacks, tank swaps for Acidic Wound, and emergency tanking for Fel Rage. One of the more coordination-heavy fights in BT.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (Normal): Tank and spank with Bloodboil group rotation and tank swaps.
Phase 2 (Fel Rage): Random player becomes Gurtogg's target for 30 seconds. They become the 'tank'.

abilities.name: Bloodboil
abilities.description: Every 10 seconds, Gurtogg hits the 5 CLOSEST players with a stacking DoT dealing 600 damage per stack every 2 seconds. Stacks up to 5 times.
abilities.handling: Split raid into 3 groups. Groups ROTATE being the closest 5 players. Group 1 soaks, then Group 2, then Group 3, then back to Group 1. This spreads the stacks so no one dies.

abilities.name: Acidic Wound
abilities.description: Stacking debuff reducing the tank's armor by 500 per stack and dealing damage over time. Stacks indefinitely.
abilities.handling: Tank swap at 10-12 stacks. Two tanks rotate. At high stacks, the tank takes massive damage.

abilities.name: Arcing Smash
abilities.description: Frontal cone attack dealing 7,500-10,000 Physical damage and knocking back anyone hit.
abilities.handling: Only tanks should be in front. Melee behind, ranged spread.

abilities.name: Fel Rage
abilities.description: Every 60 seconds, Gurtogg targets a random player and fixates on them for 30 seconds. That player gains 10,000 HP, 300% armor, and 100% damage increase, but Gurtogg only attacks them.
abilities.handling: If you get Fel Rage, you ARE the tank for 30 seconds. Run to the tank spot, face Gurtogg away from raid. Healers SPAM HEAL the Fel Rage target. They can take it but need heavy healing.

abilities.name: Insignificance
abilities.description: During Fel Rage, Gurtogg applies this to the normal tanks, reducing their threat to 0.
abilities.handling: Tanks cannot taunt during Fel Rage. The Fel Rage target MUST tank.

bosses.strategy: SETUP: Split raid into 3 groups (melee, ranged 1, ranged 2). Mark positions for each group's 'close' rotation. BLOODBOIL ROTATION: Group 1 stands closest for first Bloodboil, then moves away. Group 2 moves close for second, then Group 3. Rotate so stacks spread evenly. TANK SWAPS: Swap tanks at 10-12 Acidic Wound stacks. FEL RAGE: When it triggers, the target becomes the tank. They run to tank position. All healers focus them. After 30 seconds, normal tanking resumes. Continue rotation.
commonMistakes: Groups not rotating properly, stacks accumulate on one group
Not swapping tanks, Acidic Wound stacks kill the tank
Fel Rage target panicking instead of tanking
Healers not focusing the Fel Rage target

bosses.name: Reliquary of Souls
bosses.description: A massive reliquary containing three essences: Suffering, Desire, and Anger. Each essence has completely different mechanics, making this a three-boss fight in one. Phase 1 prohibits healing. Phase 2 punishes high DPS. Phase 3 is a pure burn race.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (Essence of Suffering): ALL HEALING IS NEGATED. DPS race to kill it before raid dies.
Intermission: Adds spawn. Kill them before Phase 2.
Phase 2 (Essence of Desire): 50% of YOUR DAMAGE heals the boss. Controlled DPS required. Interrupt Spirit Shock.
Intermission: More adds. Kill them.
Phase 3 (Essence of Anger): Burn phase. Boss deals increasing damage. Kill it fast.

abilities.name: Aura of Suffering
abilities.description: Phase 1 aura. REDUCES ALL HEALING TO ZERO. Also drains 50 HP per second from everyone.
abilities.handling: You CANNOT heal. Everyone slowly dies. Just DPS as fast as possible to kill the Essence before everyone dies. Warlocks can Life Tap for mana since healing is useless anyway.

abilities.name: Frenzy (Phase 1)
abilities.description: At 65% HP, Essence of Suffering enrages, dealing more damage.
abilities.handling: Push through it. You're racing the clock anyway.

abilities.name: Soul Drain
abilities.description: Phase 1. Channels on random players, dealing Shadow damage.
abilities.handling: Cannot be avoided. Just heal after Phase 1 ends.

abilities.name: Aura of Desire
abilities.description: Phase 2 aura. 50% of all damage dealt by players HEALS the Essence of Desire.
abilities.handling: CONTROLLED DPS. If you go too fast, you heal the boss more than you damage it. Stop DoTs. Use slow, steady damage. Make sure healing output exceeds boss healing.

abilities.name: Spirit Shock
abilities.description: Phase 2. 2.5-second cast dealing 9,000 Nature damage to a random player. Interruptible.
abilities.handling: MUST BE INTERRUPTED. Set up an interrupt rotation. If it goes off, it can one-shot people.

abilities.name: Deaden
abilities.description: Phase 2. Reduces a player's damage by 100% for 10 seconds.
abilities.handling: Just wait it out. One less person DPSing actually helps in Phase 2.

abilities.name: Aura of Anger
abilities.description: Phase 3 aura. Boss deals increasing damage over time. Raid takes more damage the longer the phase goes.
abilities.handling: This is why Phase 3 is a burn race. The longer it goes, the harder it hits.

abilities.name: Soul Scream
abilities.description: Phase 3. AoE Shadow damage and mana drain.
abilities.handling: Heal through it. Use mana potions.

abilities.name: Spite
abilities.description: Phase 3. Targets 3 random players, dealing 7,500 damage and stunning them for 6 seconds.
abilities.handling: Unavoidable. Healers must react to stun targets.

bosses.strategy: PHASE 1: ALL OUT DPS. Healing is impossible - just burn the Essence of Suffering down before everyone dies. It's a race. INTERMISSION: Kill the adds that spawn. PHASE 2: CONTROLLED DPS. Your damage heals the boss. Interrupt every Spirit Shock with a rotation. Slow, steady damage while healers keep up. INTERMISSION: Kill adds again. PHASE 3: HEROISM/BLOODLUST. Full burn. Boss deals increasing damage - kill it before it kills you. Heal through Soul Scream and Spite.
commonMistakes: Not DPSing hard enough in Phase 1 - raid dies
DPSing too hard in Phase 2 - healing the boss more than damaging
Missing Spirit Shock interrupts in Phase 2
Not bursting hard enough in Phase 3 - damage overwhelms healers

bosses.name: Mother Shahraz
bosses.description: A Shivarra priestess of the Burning Legion. This fight requires Shadow Resistance gear (minimum 270 SR) on the entire raid to survive. The main mechanics are Saber Lash (requiring 3 tanks stacked) and Fatal Attraction (teleporting players together).

gearRequirement.shadowResist: 270 minimum Shadow Resistance for all raid members
gearRequirement.sources: Shadowcloth tailoring, Hearts of Darkness crafted gear, SR enchants

abilities.name: Saber Lash
abilities.description: Every 2 seconds, Shahraz cleaves the 3 closest targets in front of her for 10,000-14,000 Physical damage SPLIT between them.
abilities.handling: THREE TANKS must stack directly in front of Shahraz at all times. They split the damage three ways. With only 2 tanks, they die. With only 1, instant death.

abilities.name: Fatal Attraction
abilities.description: Teleports 3 random players to the same location. While together, they deal 1,500 Shadow damage per second to each other. Lasts until they spread apart.
abilities.handling: If you get teleported, IMMEDIATELY run away from the other two players. The longer you stay together, the more damage you take. Spread to at least 10 yards apart.

abilities.name: Prismatic Aura
abilities.description: Shahraz cycles through different resistance auras every 15 seconds, increasing her resistance to one school while decreasing resistance to others.
abilities.handling: This affects DPS depending on their damage school. Shadow Priests suffer during Shadow aura. Can't control it - just adapt.

abilities.name: Silencing Shriek
abilities.description: AoE silence hitting everyone in front of Shahraz (100-yard range, frontal cone).
abilities.handling: ONLY tanks should be in front. Healers and ranged DPS position BEHIND Shahraz to avoid the silence.

abilities.name: Beam Abilities
abilities.description: Shahraz periodically casts various beam attacks: Sinful Beam (Shadow), Sinister Beam (Shadow), Vile Beam (Shadow), Wicked Beam (Shadow).
abilities.handling: This is why SR gear is required. Without it, beams deal 10,000+ damage. With SR, they're manageable.

bosses.strategy: POSITIONING: 3 tanks stack DIRECTLY in front of Shahraz. Everyone else positions BEHIND her to avoid Silencing Shriek. SR GEAR: Everyone must have 270+ Shadow Resistance. EXECUTION: Tanks split Saber Lash. When Fatal Attraction triggers, teleported players IMMEDIATELY spread apart. Healers keep tanks and Fatal Attraction targets alive. DPS burns. Simple execution once SR gear is obtained.
commonMistakes: Not having 3 tanks in front - Saber Lash kills them
Not having Shadow Resistance gear - beams one-shot people
Teleported players not spreading from Fatal Attraction
Healers/ranged standing in front and getting silenced

bosses.name: The Illidari Council
bosses.description: Four of Illidan's most trusted lieutenants fighting simultaneously: Gathios the Shatterer (Paladin), High Nethermancer Zerevor (Mage), Lady Malande (Priest), and Veras Darkshadow (Rogue). All four share a health pool and must die within 15 seconds of each other, or survivors resurrect dead members.

councilMembers.name: Gathios the Shatterer
councilMembers.abilities: Consecration, Seal of Blood, Hammer of Justice, Blessing of Protection (makes self immune to Physical), Judgement. Melee boss.
councilMembers.strategy: Standard tank. Tank away from the others. When he casts Blessing of Protection on himself, casters DPS him instead of physical.

councilMembers.name: High Nethermancer Zerevor
councilMembers.abilities: Arcane Bolt (7,500 damage), Blizzard, Flamestrike, Dampen Magic, Arcane Explosion if anyone is in melee range.
councilMembers.strategy: CANNOT be tanked traditionally - casts Arcane Explosion in melee. Use a Warlock tank with high Arcane/Shadow Resistance or a Mage using Spellsteal for Dampen Magic. Stand at range.

councilMembers.name: Lady Malande
councilMembers.abilities: Circle of Healing (heals ALL council members), Divine Wrath (large AoE), Reflective Shield (reflects damage).
councilMembers.strategy: INTERRUPT CIRCLE OF HEALING. This is the TOP PRIORITY of the entire fight. If she heals, you lose. When Reflective Shield is up, stop DPS on her briefly.

councilMembers.name: Veras Darkshadow
councilMembers.abilities: Deadly Poison (stacking), Vanish, Envenom. Vanishes and reappears on random targets.
councilMembers.strategy: Tank when visible. When he vanishes, he'll appear on a random player - be ready to pick him back up. Dispel Deadly Poison stacks.

bosses.sharedHealthPool: All four council members share a health pool. Damage to any of them counts toward the total. When total HP reaches 0, all four must die within 15 seconds or survivors resurrect dead members at full health.

abilities.name: Circle of Healing
abilities.description: Lady Malande heals ALL council members for 80,000-100,000 HP.
abilities.handling: INTERRUPT THIS EVERY TIME. Assign 3-4 interrupters to Malande with a rotation. Missing one Circle of Healing can reset minutes of progress.

abilities.name: Blessing of Spell Warding
abilities.description: Gathios casts this on a random council member, making them immune to spell damage for 15 seconds.
abilities.handling: Physical DPS switches to the buffed target. Casters wait or DPS other targets.

abilities.name: Blessing of Protection
abilities.description: Gathios casts this on himself, making him immune to physical damage for 15 seconds.
abilities.handling: Physical DPS switches targets. Casters focus Gathios during this window.

abilities.name: Divine Wrath
abilities.description: Lady Malande deals 3,000-4,000 Holy damage to random raid members.
abilities.handling: Heal through it. Unavoidable but manageable.

abilities.name: Reflective Shield
abilities.description: Zerevor shields himself, reflecting 25% of damage back to attackers.
abilities.handling: Stop DPSing Zerevor when shield is up. Switch to another target.

bosses.strategy: SETUP: Gathios tanked normally in one spot. Zerevor tanked by Warlock/Mage at range in another spot. Malande tanked at range by another caster. Veras picked up wherever he appears. EXECUTION: 3-4 interrupters are DEDICATED to Lady Malande - interrupt every Circle of Healing. Everyone else DPSes. When Blessing of Protection/Spell Warding goes out, switch targets appropriately. Balance DPS so all four die around the same time. At low HP, coordinate the final burn so all four die within 15 seconds.
commonMistakes: Missing Circle of Healing interrupts - fight resets
Trying to melee tank Zerevor - Arcane Explosion kills you
Not coordinating final kills - one resurrects and resets the fight
Not switching targets during immunity blessings

bosses.name: Illidan Stormrage
bosses.description: The Betrayer himself. This legendary encounter spans 5 phases over 15-20 minutes and is the pinnacle of TBC raiding. Illidan demands mastery of tank mechanics (Shear immunity), add control (Flames of Azzinoth, Parasites), and raid positioning (Demon Form). Defeating Illidan is a crowning achievement.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (100%-65%): Tank and spank with Parasites and Flame Crash. Tank must be Shear-immune.
Phase 2 (65%): Illidan flies up and spawns 2 Flames of Azzinoth. Kill both while avoiding Eye Beam.
Phase 3 (65%-30%): Returns to Phase 1 mechanics plus periodic Demon Form transitions.
Phase 4 (30%): Maiev Shadowsong joins. Illidan is periodically trapped. Burn phase.
Demon Form (Throughout Phase 3+): Every 60 seconds, Illidan transforms. Raid must spread to avoid Shadow Demons.

tankRequirement.shear: The tank MUST be immune to Shear or they die. Warriors maintain Shield Block 100% of the time. Shield Block absorbs Shear completely. If Shield Block falls off, Shear hits and the tank dies.
tankRequirement.fireResist: During Demon Form, Fire Resistance helps (365 FR cap).

abilities.name: Shear
abilities.description: Every 10 seconds, Illidan casts Shear, reducing the tank's maximum HP by 60% for 7 seconds. If the tank is not Block/Dodge/Parry immune to this, they effectively have 40% HP and will die.
abilities.handling: Warrior tank with Shield Block up at ALL TIMES. Shield Block makes Shear miss. If Shield Block is down when Shear is cast, the tank dies. This is the fundamental tank check of the encounter.

abilities.name: Draw Soul
abilities.description: Frontal cone that deals damage and heals Illidan if the target dies during the channel.
abilities.handling: Tank faces Illidan away. Keep tank alive during Draw Soul.

abilities.name: Parasitic Shadowfiend
abilities.description: Spawns a parasite on a random player. If not killed within 10 seconds, it multiplies into 2 parasites. Each multiplication doubles the count.
abilities.handling: KILL PARASITES IMMEDIATELY. Assign DPS to instantly switch and kill them. If they multiply more than once, you wipe to exponential parasite growth.

abilities.name: Flame Crash
abilities.description: Creates a fire zone on the ground dealing heavy Fire damage to anyone standing in it.
abilities.handling: Move out of fire. Keep the area clear for positioning.

abilities.name: Flames of Azzinoth
abilities.description: Phase 2: Illidan throws his Warglaives, spawning 2 Flames of Azzinoth adds. Each has 1M HP and deals heavy Fire damage.
abilities.handling: Two tanks pick up one Flame each. Tank them apart. DPS burns both down. When both die, Phase 3 begins.

abilities.name: Eye Beam
abilities.description: Phase 2: Illidan hovers and fires a beam that tracks players. Deals 20,000+ Fire damage per second.
abilities.handling: Run PERPENDICULAR to the beam direction. The beam tracks slowly - you can outrun it by moving sideways. Don't run directly away.

abilities.name: Dark Barrage
abilities.description: Phase 2: Channels Shadow damage at a random player for 10 seconds.
abilities.handling: All healers focus the Dark Barrage target. They take massive sustained damage.

abilities.name: Demon Form
abilities.description: Phase 3+: Every 60 seconds, Illidan transforms into Demon Form for 60 seconds. Different abilities active.
abilities.handling: During Demon Form, raid spreads out. Tank positions change. See Demon Form abilities below.

abilities.name: Shadow Blast (Demon Form)
abilities.description: Demon Form tank attack dealing 10,000 Shadow damage.
abilities.handling: Warlock or high-FR tank can take over during Demon Form. Or original tank with FR gear.

abilities.name: Flame Burst (Demon Form)
abilities.description: Demon Form: Deals 3,500 Fire damage to random players.
abilities.handling: Heal through it. Unavoidable.

abilities.name: Shadow Demons (Demon Form)
abilities.description: Demon Form: Spawns 4 Shadow Demons that fixate on random players. If they reach their target, they paralyze them and deal lethal damage.
abilities.handling: KILL SHADOW DEMONS IMMEDIATELY. They're low HP but must die before reaching their targets. Assign DPS to them.

abilities.name: Agonizing Flames (Demon Form)
abilities.description: Demon Form: Massive Fire AoE centered on Illidan. Everyone within 25 yards takes 4,000+ Fire damage per second.
abilities.handling: SPREAD OUT during Demon Form. Everyone must be at least 25 yards from Illidan. Pre-assigned positions help.

abilities.name: Maiev's Aid (Phase 4)
abilities.description: At 30%, Maiev Shadowsong arrives. She periodically traps Illidan with Cage of Shadows, stunning him for 15 seconds.
abilities.handling: When Illidan is trapped, he takes 100% increased damage. Pop all remaining cooldowns and BURN.

bosses.strategy: PHASE 1: Warrior tank maintains Shield Block 100%. Kill Parasites immediately. Move from Flame Crash. PHASE 2: Two tanks grab Flames of Azzinoth. Raid burns them while avoiding Eye Beam (run perpendicular). Heal Dark Barrage target. PHASE 3: Back to Phase 1 mechanics but with Demon Form every 60 seconds. During Demon Form, everyone spreads 25+ yards from Illidan. Kill Shadow Demons instantly. Return to normal positions after. PHASE 4 (30%): Maiev joins. When Illidan is trapped, pop Heroism/Bloodlust and all cooldowns. Maximum burn. Continue handling Demon Form transitions until dead.
commonMistakes: Tank losing Shield Block and dying to Shear
Not killing Parasites immediately - exponential multiplication wipes raid
Getting hit by Eye Beam in Phase 2
Not spreading during Demon Form - Agonizing Flames kills melee
Shadow Demons reaching their targets
Not bursting during Maiev's trap windows

phase4.name: Phase 4: Zul'Aman
phase4.description: A 10-player timed raid set in the troll city of Zul'Aman. Features the legendary 'bear run' timed event for the Amani War Bear mount.

zulaman.name: Zul'Aman
zulaman.description: A challenging 10-player troll raid featuring the legendary timed 'bear run' event. When you first speak to Harrison Jones at the entrance, a 45-minute timer begins. Saving all 4 prisoners before their respective bosses die awards the Amani War Bear mount to one player. This raid drops excellent catch-up gear equivalent to T5/early T6.

bearRunInfo.prisoners: 4 prisoners to rescue: one before each of the first 4 bosses
bearRunInfo.reward: Amani War Bear mount (one per run) if all 4 prisoners are saved
bearRunInfo.strategy: Skip unnecessary trash, use drums/heroism efficiently, have fast clear times on each boss

recommendedComposition.notes: Bring strong AoE (Mages, Warlocks) for Jan'alai eggs. Shamans provide Heroism for faster bear runs. Hunter Misdirection helps with Hex Lord adds. Paladins excellent for bear run tank threat. Priests useful for dispels on Hex Lord.

minimumGear.tanks: 16,000+ health unbuffed, 490 Defense, mix of Tier 5/6 or Badge gear
minimumGear.dps: Tier 5 equivalent or better. Bear runs require significantly higher DPS output.

zulaman.tierTokens: No tier tokens - drops unique high-ilvl gear and Badges of Justice

bosses.name: Akil'zon
bosses.description: The Eagle Avatar of Zul'Aman. First boss of the bear run timer. The Electrical Storm mechanic is the key to this fight - failing to collapse under the floating player means death.
bosses.bearRunTimer: First prisoner - save before killing Akil'zon
phaseBreakdown: Single Phase: Tank and spank with periodic Electrical Storm. Collapse under floating player during storm, spread out otherwise.

abilities.name: Static Disruption
abilities.description: Places a debuff on a random player increasing Nature damage taken by 25% for 20 seconds. Jumps to nearby players within 12 yards.
abilities.handling: SPREAD OUT at least 12 yards to prevent chaining. This debuff makes Electrical Storm more dangerous.

abilities.name: Gust of Wind
abilities.description: Knocks a random player back a significant distance.
abilities.handling: Position away from platform edges. Getting knocked off requires running back up and wastes time.

abilities.name: Electrical Storm
abilities.description: Every 60 seconds, a random player is lifted into the air and an electrical storm forms. Anyone NOT directly under the floating player takes 3,500 Nature damage per second for 8 seconds.
abilities.handling: THE MOMENT someone floats up, EVERYONE sprints directly under them. Stack tightly beneath the floating player. After 8 seconds, immediately spread out again to avoid Static Disruption chains.

abilities.name: Call Lightning
abilities.description: Lightning bolt dealing 3,500-4,500 Nature damage to a random player.
abilities.handling: Unavoidable random damage. Healers keep everyone healthy.

abilities.name: Amani Eagle Adds
abilities.description: Eagle adds periodically swoop down and attack random players.
abilities.handling: AoE them down. They have low HP but are annoying if ignored.

bosses.strategy: POSITIONING: Spread out in a loose circle around the boss, at least 12 yards apart. Tank holds boss in center. ELECTRICAL STORM: When someone floats up, EVERYONE runs under them immediately. You have about 2 seconds to get there. Stack tightly, then spread back out after the storm ends. BEAR RUN: Save the prisoner BEFORE engaging the boss. Clear quickly - this is an easy boss mechanically.
commonMistakes: Not collapsing under the floating player during Electrical Storm
Standing too close and chaining Static Disruption
Getting knocked off the platform by Gust of Wind

bosses.name: Nalorakk
bosses.description: The Bear Avatar of Zul'Aman. Second bear run boss. Alternates between Troll Form (two tanks split damage) and Bear Form (heavy bleed on main tank). The easiest boss in ZA.
bosses.bearRunTimer: Second prisoner - save before killing Nalorakk
phaseBreakdown: Troll Form: Two tanks split Brutal Swipe in front of boss.
Bear Form: Single tank, heavy healing required for Mangle bleed.
Cycle: Alternates every 45 seconds.

abilities.name: Brutal Swipe
abilities.description: Troll Form only. Deals 14,000-18,000 Physical damage split between the two closest targets in front of Nalorakk.
abilities.handling: TWO TANKS must stack directly in front of Nalorakk during Troll Form. They split the damage, taking 7,000-9,000 each. With only one tank, it's likely fatal.

abilities.name: Mangle
abilities.description: Bear Form only. Applies a stacking bleed to the tank dealing 1,735 damage every 2 seconds for 30 seconds. Stacks.
abilities.handling: Heavy healing on the tank during Bear Form. The bleed stacks if he doesn't switch back to Troll Form. Use tank cooldowns during Bear Form.

abilities.name: Surge
abilities.description: Bear Form only. Charges a random player, dealing moderate damage and briefly stunning them.
abilities.handling: Healers be ready to heal the charge target. Not usually deadly.

abilities.name: Deafening Roar
abilities.description: Bear Form only. AoE roar that silences the entire raid for 2 seconds.
abilities.handling: Pre-HoT the tank before Bear Form. The silence prevents casting during a critical healing phase.

abilities.name: Lacerating Slash
abilities.description: Bear Form only. Additional bleed on the tank.
abilities.handling: More healing required. Stack with Mangle for heavy tank damage.

bosses.strategy: TROLL FORM: Two tanks stack in front, everyone else behind. Tanks split Brutal Swipe. DPS burns. BEAR FORM: Only main tank in front. Healers focus the tank heavily - Mangle stacks hurt. Pre-HoT before Deafening Roar silences you. DPS continues. REPEAT: Forms alternate every 45 seconds. Very simple once you understand the pattern.
commonMistakes: Only one tank in front during Troll Form - they die to Brutal Swipe
Not pre-healing the tank before Deafening Roar silence
Healers not focusing tank during Bear Form bleed stacks

bosses.name: Jan'alai
bosses.description: The Dragonhawk Avatar of Zul'Aman. Third bear run boss. This fight is about egg management - Hatchers periodically spawn to hatch eggs, and at 35% HP ALL remaining eggs hatch at once. Too many dragonhawks = wipe.
bosses.bearRunTimer: Third prisoner - save before killing Jan'alai
phaseBreakdown: Main Phase: Control Hatchers to manage egg hatching. Keep egg counts balanced between sides.
Fire Bomb Phase: Navigate fire bomb patterns.
35% HP: All remaining eggs hatch. If too many remain, you're overwhelmed.

abilities.name: Flame Breath
abilities.description: Frontal cone dealing heavy Fire damage.
abilities.handling: Only tank in front. Face boss away from raid.

abilities.name: Summon Amani'shi Hatcher
abilities.description: Every 90 seconds, two Hatchers spawn (one per side). Each Hatcher runs to eggs and hatches them one at a time.
abilities.handling: CONTROLLED HATCHING: Kill ONE Hatcher immediately. Let the surviving Hatcher hatch a few eggs (3-4) before killing it. Repeat each wave. This controls the flow of adds.

abilities.name: Amani Dragonhawk Hatchling
abilities.description: Small adds hatched from eggs. Low HP but deal Fire damage and pile up.
abilities.handling: AoE them down as they hatch. Don't let them stack up.

abilities.name: Fire Bomb
abilities.description: Jan'alai teleports to center and spawns fire bombs across the platform in a pattern. Standing in bombs = death.
abilities.handling: When Jan'alai teleports to center, find safe spots between bomb patterns. They explode in sequence, creating safe corridors.

abilities.name: Hatch All Eggs
abilities.description: At 35% HP, Jan'alai hatches ALL remaining eggs at once.
abilities.handling: CRITICAL: By 35%, you want most eggs already hatched and killed. If 20+ eggs hatch at once, you wipe to dragonhawk swarm.

bosses.strategy: EGG MANAGEMENT: Let Hatchers hatch 3-4 eggs per side, then kill the Hatcher. AoE the dragonhawks as they spawn. Keep egg counts roughly balanced between sides. Goal: Have most eggs hatched and cleared BEFORE 35%. FIRE BOMBS: When Jan'alai teleports to center, stop DPS and focus on avoiding bombs. Find safe spots. FINAL BURN: Below 35%, any remaining eggs hatch. If you managed eggs properly, this is just a few adds. Pop cooldowns and burn Jan'alai.
commonMistakes: Not controlling Hatchers, leading to egg imbalance
Letting too many eggs survive to 35% - mass hatch overwhelms
Getting hit by Fire Bombs
Not balancing eggs between left and right sides

bosses.name: Halazzi
bosses.description: The Lynx Avatar of Zul'Aman. Fourth and final bear run boss. At 75%, 50%, and 25% HP, Halazzi splits into his Troll form and a separate Spirit Lynx that must be off-tanked.
bosses.bearRunTimer: Fourth prisoner - save before killing Halazzi (LAST chance for bear mount)
phaseBreakdown: Normal Phase: Standard tanking with totem management.
Spirit Phase (75%, 50%, 25%): Halazzi splits into Troll + Spirit Lynx. Off-tank grabs Lynx. Kill Lynx to force merge.
Cycle: Three split phases total.

abilities.name: Saber Lash
abilities.description: Frontal cleave dealing heavy damage.
abilities.handling: Only tank in front. Face boss away from raid.

abilities.name: Frenzy
abilities.description: Below 25% HP, Halazzi enrages, increasing attack speed and damage.
abilities.handling: Use Tranquilizing Shot if available, otherwise heal through the increased damage.

abilities.name: Spirit of the Lynx
abilities.description: At 75%, 50%, and 25% HP, Halazzi splits. The Spirit Lynx spawns as a separate mob and attacks the raid.
abilities.handling: OFF-TANK immediately picks up the Spirit Lynx. DPS kills the Lynx. When Lynx dies, Halazzi reforms and the normal phase resumes.

abilities.name: Flame Shock
abilities.description: During Spirit Phase, the Troll casts Flame Shock on random players - Fire damage + DoT.
abilities.handling: Dispel the DoT. Heal through initial damage.

abilities.name: Corrupted Lightning Totem
abilities.description: During Spirit Phase, spawns a totem that deals Nature damage to the raid.
abilities.handling: KILL TOTEM IMMEDIATELY. It does significant damage if left alive.

abilities.name: Earth Shock
abilities.description: During Spirit Phase, the Troll casts Earth Shock dealing Nature damage.
abilities.handling: Interruptible. Interrupt if possible, otherwise heal through it.

bosses.strategy: NORMAL PHASE: Tank and spank. Face boss away for Saber Lash. SPIRIT PHASE (75%, 50%, 25%): Halazzi splits. Off-tank grabs the Spirit Lynx. Kill the Lightning Totem immediately. DPS burns the Lynx. When Lynx dies, normal phase resumes. REPEAT through all three split phases. BEAR RUN: This is the LAST prisoner. If you're doing bear run, save the prisoner BEFORE engaging.
commonMistakes: Off-tank not picking up Spirit Lynx quickly
Not killing Lightning Totem - raid takes heavy damage
Not having an off-tank ready for split phases
Missing the fourth prisoner for bear run

bosses.name: Hex Lord Malacrass
bosses.description: The Hex Lord of Zul'Aman. Fifth boss (not part of bear run). Accompanied by 4 random adds from a pool of 8 possible. His signature ability steals class powers from raid members.
phaseBreakdown: Single Phase: Kill adds, then burn Malacrass while handling stolen abilities and Spirit Bolts.
randomAdds: Alyson Antille (Blood Elf Priest) - Heals, must be interrupted
Lord Raadan (Dragonkin) - Flame Breath and Thunderclap
Darkheart (Blackheart the Inciter type) - Mind Control

abilities.name: Spirit Bolts
abilities.description: Every 40 seconds, Malacrass channels Spirit Bolts for 10 seconds, dealing Shadow damage to the entire raid every second.
abilities.handling: Stack for AoE healing during Spirit Bolts. Use healing cooldowns. This is unavoidable raid-wide damage.

abilities.name: Siphon Soul
abilities.description: Malacrass drains a random player, gaining abilities based on their CLASS for 30 seconds. The drained player is damaged over time.
abilities.handling: VARIES BY CLASS. See stolen abilities below. Heal the drained player. Prepare to counter whatever ability he steals.

abilities.name: Drain Power
abilities.description: Stacking debuff reducing a stat from the entire raid by 1% per stack. Also buffs Malacrass's damage.
abilities.handling: The fight is a DPS race because of this. The longer it goes, the weaker you get and the stronger he gets.

abilities.name: Stolen Abilities (Examples)
abilities.description: Paladin: Consecration, Holy Light. Priest: Psychic Scream, Heal. Druid: Lifebloom, Thorns. Mage: Frostbolt, Frost Nova. Warlock: Rain of Fire, Curse of Doom. Shaman: Fire Nova Totem, Healing Wave. Hunter: Aimed Shot, Freezing Trap. Warrior: Mortal Strike, Whirlwind. Rogue: Wound Poison, Slice and Dice.
abilities.handling: Interrupt heals he steals. Dispel debuffs. Move out of ground effects. Each stolen ability requires a different response.

bosses.strategy: ADDS FIRST: Kill or CC the 4 random adds. Priority varies by composition - healers/casters first usually. MALACRASS: Tank and spank while handling mechanics. During Spirit Bolts, stack and use AoE healing cooldowns. When he steals abilities via Siphon Soul, respond appropriately (interrupt heals, dispel debuffs, move from ground effects). DPS RACE: Drain Power stacks make this a race. Burn him down before you're too weak.
commonMistakes: Not killing/CCing dangerous adds (like healing priests)
Not stacking for Spirit Bolts - healing is inefficient
Not countering stolen abilities appropriately
Taking too long and getting overwhelmed by Drain Power stacks

bosses.name: Zul'jin
bosses.description: The legendary Warlord of the Amani trolls and final boss of Zul'Aman. Zul'jin transforms through 5 phases, each channeling a different Loa's animal aspect. Each phase has completely unique mechanics.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 - Troll (100%-80%): Standard melee with Grievous Throw bleed.
Phase 2 - Bear (80%-60%): Heavy tank damage, Creeping Paralysis on raid.
Phase 3 - Eagle (60%-40%): Tornados spawn, constant Nature damage.
Phase 4 - Lynx (40%-20%): Rapid Lynx Rushes on raid, heavy damage.
Phase 5 - Dragonhawk (20%-0%): Fire columns, Flame Breath, burn phase.

abilities.name: Grievous Throw
abilities.description: Phase 1 only. Throws an axe at a random player, applying a bleed that deals 2,500 damage every 2 seconds until the target is healed to FULL HP.
abilities.handling: HEAL TO FULL. The bleed does NOT stop until the target is at 100% HP. Partial healing just delays the inevitable. Top them off completely.

abilities.name: Creeping Paralysis
abilities.description: Phase 2 only. Debuff that stacks every 2 seconds, slowing movement. At 4 stacks, the player is stunned for 5 seconds.
abilities.handling: DISPEL before 4 stacks. Druids and Paladins can remove this. If you get stunned, you stop DPSing for 5 seconds.

abilities.name: Overpower
abilities.description: Phase 2 only. Heavy physical hit on the tank for 12,000-15,000 damage.
abilities.handling: Heavy tank healing required during Bear phase. Use tank cooldowns.

abilities.name: Feather Vortex
abilities.description: Phase 3 only. Spawns multiple tornados that move around the room. Contact deals Nature damage and knocks you back.
abilities.handling: AVOID TORNADOS. They move in patterns. Keep mobile while DPSing.

abilities.name: Energy Storm
abilities.description: Phase 3 only. Constant Nature damage to the entire raid throughout the phase.
abilities.handling: AoE healing throughout Phase 3. It's constant - keep the raid topped.

abilities.name: Claw Rage
abilities.description: Phase 4 only. Zul'jin attacks the tank with extremely rapid melee strikes for several seconds.
abilities.handling: Tank cooldowns. Heavy focused healing. This phase is brutal on tanks.

abilities.name: Lynx Rush
abilities.description: Phase 4 only. Zul'jin charges random raid members multiple times in quick succession, dealing damage to each.
abilities.handling: Spread out so charges only hit one person. Healers react quickly to each charge target.

abilities.name: Flame Whirl
abilities.description: Phase 5 only. Spawns columns of fire that move around the room.
abilities.handling: Navigate between fire columns. They persist and limit movement space.

abilities.name: Flame Breath
abilities.description: Phase 5 only. Frontal cone Fire damage.
abilities.handling: Only tank in front. Face boss away from raid.

abilities.name: Pillar of Fire
abilities.description: Phase 5 only. Fire erupts under random players.
abilities.handling: Keep moving. Don't stand still.

bosses.strategy: PHASE 1 (Troll): Simple tank and spank. HEAL GRIEVOUS THROW TARGETS TO FULL. PHASE 2 (Bear): Dispel Creeping Paralysis. Heavy tank healing for Overpower. PHASE 3 (Eagle): Avoid tornados while healing through Energy Storm. Keep mobile. PHASE 4 (Lynx): Spread out for Lynx Rush. Tank cooldowns for Claw Rage. Heavy healing phase. PHASE 5 (Dragonhawk): Pop HEROISM/BLOODLUST. Navigate fire columns. Burn him down. This phase is the final burn - use all remaining cooldowns.
commonMistakes: Not healing Grievous Throw to FULL - bleed never stops
Not dispelling Creeping Paralysis - stuns waste DPS
Getting hit by tornados in Phase 3
Not spreading for Lynx Rush in Phase 4
Not saving Heroism for Phase 5 burn

phase5.name: Phase 5: Sunwell Plateau
phase5.description: The final and most challenging raid tier of The Burning Crusade. Sunwell Plateau features 6 brutally difficult bosses culminating in the legendary Kil'jaeden encounter. This raid was considered nearly impossible at release and remains the pinnacle of TBC raiding.

sunwell_plateau.name: Sunwell Plateau
sunwell_plateau.attunement: None required (originally gated by patch releases)
sunwell_plateau.description: The ultimate TBC raid challenge. Sunwell Plateau houses the corrupted Sunwell and Kil'jaeden, one of the most difficult encounters ever created in World of Warcraft. Pre-nerf M'uru was considered literally impossible by some guilds. This raid demands perfection.

recommendedComposition.notes: Extremely high gear requirements. Full BT/Hyjal gear minimum. Multiple Shamans for Heroism cycling. Strong AoE for M'uru. Shadow Resistance useful for several fights.

minimumGear.tanks: 18,000+ health unbuffed, full Tier 6 with multiple resist sets, expertise capped
minimumGear.healers: 2,000+ healing power, 12,000+ mana, Shadow Resistance for Eredar Twins
minimumGear.dps: Full Black Temple/Hyjal gear minimum. M'uru requires raid-wide 22,000+ DPS. Brutallus is a hard gear check.

sunwell_plateau.tierTokens: Drops Tier 6.5 equivalent gear (ilvl 154-164) and legendary Thori'dal bow

bosses.name: Kalecgos
bosses.description: The blue dragon Kalecgos, possessed by the demon Sathrovarr. This unique encounter takes place in two realms simultaneously - the normal realm where you fight Kalecgos, and the demon realm where you fight Sathrovarr. Players rotate between realms via portals.
phaseBreakdown: Two Simultaneous Fights: Normal Realm (Kalecgos) and Demon Realm (Sathrovarr) run concurrently.
Portal Rotation: Players are periodically teleported to demon realm. After 60 seconds in demon realm, you're teleported back.
Kill Condition: Both Kalecgos AND Sathrovarr must die within 10 seconds of each other.

realmMechanics.normalRealm: Fight Kalecgos (dragon form). Tank him facing away. Avoid Frost Breath. Tank swaps for Arcane Buffet stacks.
realmMechanics.demonRealm: Fight Sathrovarr. More dangerous - Curse of Boundless Agony must be dispelled. Shadow Bolt Volley requires heavy healing.
realmMechanics.portalTransition: Spectral Blast teleports random players to demon realm. You stay there 60 seconds, then return to normal realm.

abilities.name: Arcane Buffet
abilities.description: Normal Realm: Stacking Arcane debuff on the tank, increasing Arcane damage taken by 500 per stack. Stacks indefinitely.
abilities.handling: Tank swap at 10-12 stacks. Two tanks rotate in normal realm.

abilities.name: Frost Breath
abilities.description: Normal Realm: Frontal cone dealing 10,000+ Frost damage.
abilities.handling: Only tank in front. Face Kalecgos away from raid.

abilities.name: Spectral Blast
abilities.description: Teleports random players to the Demon Realm to fight Sathrovarr.
abilities.handling: When teleported, immediately engage Sathrovarr. You'll fight in demon realm for 60 seconds before returning.

abilities.name: Tail Lash
abilities.description: Normal Realm: Damages and knocks back anyone behind Kalecgos.
abilities.handling: Don't stand directly behind the dragon.

abilities.name: Curse of Boundless Agony
abilities.description: Demon Realm: DoT that deals increasing Shadow damage over time. When dispelled or expires, it jumps to nearby players.
abilities.handling: MUST be dispelled. Affected player should move away from others before dispel to prevent spreading.

abilities.name: Shadow Bolt Volley
abilities.description: Demon Realm: AoE Shadow damage to everyone in demon realm.
abilities.handling: Heavy AoE healing required in demon realm.

abilities.name: Corrupting Strike
abilities.description: Demon Realm: Sathrovarr's main tank attack.
abilities.handling: Keep demon realm tank alive. Tank swap for debuffs if needed.

bosses.strategy: REALM MANAGEMENT: Start with main tank on Kalecgos, off-tank ready for demon realm. As players get teleported via Spectral Blast, they engage Sathrovarr in demon realm. NORMAL REALM: Tank Kalecgos, swap at 10+ Arcane Buffet stacks. Avoid breath. DEMON REALM: Dispel Curse of Boundless Agony carefully (spread first). Heavy AoE healing through Shadow Bolt Volley. KILL TIMING: Both bosses must die within 10 seconds. Coordinate DPS between realms - use voice comms to call HP percentages. If one dies and the other survives 10 seconds, the dead one resurrects.
commonMistakes: Not dispelling Curse of Boundless Agony, causing escalating damage
Dispelling Curse without spreading, causing it to chain
Killing one boss too far ahead of the other
Not having tanks ready in both realms

bosses.name: Brutallus
bosses.description: A massive Pit Lord and one of the most infamous gear check bosses in WoW history. Brutallus is a pure DPS race with a tight 6-minute enrage timer. The mechanics are simple but demanding - stack for Meteor Slash, run out with Burn. If your raid doesn't have enough DPS, you literally cannot win.
phaseBreakdown: Single Phase: Pure DPS race. Stack for Meteor Slash, run out with Burn. Beat the 6-minute enrage or wipe.

gearCheck.requiredRaidDPS: Approximately 22,000-23,000 raid DPS to beat the enrage timer
gearCheck.tankRequirements: Tanks need 20,000+ HP, high avoidance. Brutallus hits HARD.
gearCheck.notes: Full BT/Hyjal gear is the minimum. Full consumables (flasks, food, elixirs, weapon oils) are mandatory.

abilities.name: Meteor Slash
