abilities.description: Every 12 seconds, Brutallus slams the ground in front of him, dealing 20,000 Fire damage SPLIT among all players hit. Also increases Fire damage taken by 75% for 40 seconds (stacks).
abilities.handling: ENTIRE RAID stacks in front of Brutallus to split damage. With 25 people, each person takes ~800 damage. With 5 people, each takes 4,000. The stacking debuff makes this deadly if not split properly.

abilities.name: Burn
abilities.description: Places a DoT on a random player dealing 3,000 Fire damage per tick, increasing by 100% every 10 seconds. When the debuff expires or is dispelled, it jumps to the nearest player.
abilities.handling: BURN TARGET RUNS OUT of the raid immediately. Stay out until debuff expires (60 seconds). If you stay in the raid, when Burn jumps it'll spread to someone stacking for Meteor Slash.

abilities.name: Stomp
abilities.description: AoE attack dealing 4,000-6,000 Physical damage to everyone within 15 yards and knocking them back.
abilities.handling: Affects melee and tanks. Healers be ready for burst damage on melee group.

bosses.strategy: POSITIONING: Everyone stacks in front of Brutallus to split Meteor Slash. Two tanks swap due to Stomp knockback. BURN: When you get Burn, RUN OUT immediately. Go to a designated spot away from the raid. Wait 60 seconds for it to expire. DO NOT DISPEL - dispelling makes it jump instantly. ENRAGE: You have 6 minutes. This is a hard DPS check. If you don't have the gear, you cannot win. Pop Heroism at the start, use all cooldowns on cooldown. Full consumables mandatory.
commonMistakes: Not stacking for Meteor Slash - people get one-shot
Burn targets not running out - Burn chains through the raid
Dispelling Burn instead of letting it expire
Not having enough raid DPS to beat the 6-minute enrage

bosses.name: Felmyst
bosses.description: The reanimated corpse of Madrigosa, corrupted by Brutallus's fel energy. Felmyst alternates between Ground Phase (standard dragon fight) and Air Phase (the infamous breath mechanic). One hit from Fog of Corruption in air phase means mind control and likely wipe.
phaseBreakdown: Ground Phase (60 seconds): Standard dragon tanking with tank swaps. Gas Nova and Encapsulate mechanics.
Air Phase (60 seconds): Felmyst flies and breathes Demonic Vapor three times. Anyone hit is mind controlled. Skeletal adds spawn.
Cycle: Alternates until dead.

abilities.name: Cleave
abilities.description: Ground Phase: Frontal cleave dealing heavy Physical damage.
abilities.handling: Only tank in front.

abilities.name: Corrosion
abilities.description: Ground Phase: Stacking armor debuff on the tank, reducing armor by 10% per stack.
abilities.handling: Tank swap at 5-6 stacks.

abilities.name: Gas Nova
abilities.description: Ground Phase: AoE dealing 2,500 Nature damage and knocking back everyone within 20 yards.
abilities.handling: Spread loosely, heal through the damage.

abilities.name: Encapsulate
abilities.description: Ground Phase: Traps a random player in a cyclone, dealing damage over time and making them unable to act.
abilities.handling: Heavy healing on encapsulated player. They can't do anything but take damage.

abilities.name: Demonic Vapor (Fog of Corruption)
abilities.description: Air Phase: Felmyst flies over the raid THREE TIMES, breathing a trail of green fog. The fog persists on the ground. Anyone who touches the fog is MIND CONTROLLED for the rest of the fight.
abilities.handling: ABSOLUTE PRIORITY: Do not touch the green fog. When air phase starts, pre-position at safe spots. Watch where Felmyst flies and move to avoid the breath path. Mind controlled players gain 500% damage and must be killed.

abilities.name: Unyielding Dead
abilities.description: Air Phase: Skeleton adds spawn that must be controlled.
abilities.handling: Off-tank picks up skeletons. AoE them down between breaths.

bosses.strategy: GROUND PHASE: Tank Felmyst normally. Tank swap at 5-6 Corrosion stacks. Spread loosely for Gas Nova. Heavy heal Encapsulate targets. DPS burns. AIR PHASE: When Felmyst takes off, move to PRE-ASSIGNED SAFE SPOTS. Watch her flight path. She'll breath three times, each leaving a trail of fog. STAY OUT OF THE FOG. Kill skeleton adds between breaths. After third breath, return to ground phase positions. REPEAT until dead. One person touching fog often means a wipe.
commonMistakes: Touching Demonic Vapor fog - instant mind control
Not having pre-assigned safe spots for air phase
Not tank swapping for Corrosion stacks
Not healing Encapsulate targets

bosses.name: Eredar Twins
bosses.description: Lady Sacrolash (Shadow) and Grand Warlock Alythess (Fire) - twin Eredar commanders. They must be tanked 40+ yards apart and killed within 15 seconds of each other. The twist: being hit by one sister's abilities makes you take MORE damage from the other sister.
phaseBreakdown: Single Phase: Tank twins apart. DPS splits based on debuffs. Kill within 15 seconds of each other.

debuffMechanic.darkTouched: Applied by Sacrolash abilities. Makes you take 25% MORE Fire damage. Removes Fire Touched.
debuffMechanic.fireTouched: Applied by Alythess abilities. Makes you take 25% MORE Shadow damage. Removes Dark Touched.
debuffMechanic.strategy: Players with Dark Touched should DPS Sacrolash (Shadow). Players with Fire Touched should DPS Alythess (Fire). This minimizes damage taken.

abilities.name: Shadow Nova
abilities.description: Sacrolash: AoE Shadow damage around her, applies Dark Touched.
abilities.handling: Spread out near Sacrolash to minimize splash. Dark Touched players move to Alythess.

abilities.name: Confounding Blow
abilities.description: Sacrolash: Confuses her tank for 4 seconds.
abilities.handling: Off-tank taunts when main tank is confused.

abilities.name: Shadow Blades
abilities.description: Sacrolash: Throws shadow blades at random targets.
abilities.handling: Heal through it.

abilities.name: Conflagration
abilities.description: Alythess: Burns a random player, dealing Fire damage and spreading fire to nearby players.
abilities.handling: Conflag target runs away from others immediately. Applies Fire Touched.

abilities.name: Flame Sear
abilities.description: Alythess: Fire damage to random players.
abilities.handling: Heal through it.

abilities.name: Blaze
abilities.description: Alythess: Places a fire patch under a random player.
abilities.handling: Move out of fire.

abilities.name: Pyrogenics
abilities.description: Alythess: Increases Fire damage dealt by nearby allies.
abilities.handling: Keep twins separated to prevent buff stacking.

bosses.strategy: POSITIONING: Tank Sacrolash on one side, Alythess on the other, at least 40 yards apart. DPS splits into two groups. DEBUFF MANAGEMENT: If you get Dark Touched (from Sacrolash), move to fight Alythess (she does Fire, you resist Shadow). If you get Fire Touched (from Alythess), move to fight Sacrolash. This minimizes cross-damage. KILL TIMING: Both must die within 15 seconds. Call HP percentages. Balance DPS. If one dies and the other lives 15 seconds, the dead one resurrects at full HP and the survivor enrages.
commonMistakes: Twins too close together - abilities overlap
Not swapping based on debuffs - taking extra damage
Killing one twin too far ahead - resurrection triggers
Conflagration target not running out

bosses.name: M'uru
bosses.description: A corrupted Naaru that transforms into the void god Entropius. Pre-nerf M'uru was considered by many to be THE hardest boss in TBC history. Phase 1 is an insane add management challenge. Phase 2 is a pure burn race with void zones. Many guilds broke on this fight.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (M'uru): Fight the Naaru while managing two types of add waves spawning from portals. Constant raid damage. Chaos.
Phase 2 (Entropius): M'uru transforms into Entropius when reaching 0 HP. Pure burn race with void zones and increasing damage.

addManagement.humanoids: Spawn from LEFT portal every 30 seconds. Include Fury Mages (Pyroblast) and Berserkers (melee). CC Mages, kill Berserkers.
addManagement.voidSentinels: Spawn from RIGHT portal every 30 seconds. Large adds with high HP. Off-tanks pick up and burn down.
addManagement.darkFiends: Spawn periodically and chase random players. Kite and AoE.
addManagement.priority: Void Sentinels > Humanoid Fury Mages > Humanoid Berserkers > Dark Fiends

abilities.name: Negative Energy
abilities.description: Phase 1: Constant Shadow damage pulse to the entire raid every 3 seconds.
abilities.handling: Non-stop AoE healing required throughout Phase 1.

abilities.name: Darkness
abilities.description: Phase 1: Creates a dark zone that deals Shadow damage to anyone inside.
abilities.handling: Move out of Darkness zones.

abilities.name: Summon Void Sentinel
abilities.description: Phase 1: Large add spawning from the right portal. High HP, hits hard.
abilities.handling: Off-tank picks up immediately. DPS burns. Shadow Resistance gear helps.

abilities.name: Summon Dark Fiend
abilities.description: Phase 1: Small adds that fixate on random players and explode on contact.
abilities.handling: Kite away from raid. AoE them down.

abilities.name: Void Zone
abilities.description: Phase 2: Black holes spawn under random players, dealing massive Shadow damage.
abilities.handling: MOVE OUT immediately. The room fills with void zones over time.

abilities.name: Singularity
abilities.description: Phase 2: Entropius periodically pulls all players toward him.
abilities.handling: Run against the pull. Don't get dragged into void zones.

abilities.name: Negative Energy (Phase 2)
abilities.description: Phase 2: Increased raid-wide Shadow damage compared to Phase 1.
abilities.handling: Massive healing required. Use all healing cooldowns.

bosses.strategy: PHASE 1: Split raid for add management. One group handles humanoids (left), one handles Void Sentinels (right). CC Fury Mages or they Pyroblast the raid. Burn Void Sentinels fast. Kite Dark Fiends. Constant AoE healing for Negative Energy. DPS M'uru whenever possible. PHASE 2: M'uru transforms to Entropius at 0 HP. BURN PHASE. Pop Heroism/Bloodlust. Avoid void zones. Run against Singularity pull. Spam healing through escalating damage. Kill Entropius before the room fills with void zones and healing can't keep up. This fight is pure chaos - execution must be perfect.
commonMistakes: Not controlling Fury Mages - Pyroblasts one-shot people
Void Sentinels overwhelming tanks - not enough DPS on adds
Standing in void zones in Phase 2
Getting pulled into void zones by Singularity
Running out of healing throughput in Phase 2

bosses.name: Kil'jaeden
bosses.description: The Deceiver, Lord of the Burning Legion, and the final boss of The Burning Crusade. Kil'jaeden emerges from the Sunwell in an epic encounter spanning multiple phases. The infamous Darkness of a Thousand Souls requires precise use of Dragon Orbs. Defeating Kil'jaeden is the crowning achievement of TBC raiding.
phaseBreakdown: Phase 1 (100%-85%): Introduction. Basic abilities, learning the mechanics.
Phase 2 (85%-55%): Shield Orbs spawn. Flame Darts add raid damage.
Phase 3 (55%-25%): Darkness of a Thousand Souls cast. Dragon Orbs must be used to shield the raid.
Phase 4 (25%-0%): Armageddon meteors. Sinister Reflections. Final burn.

dragonOrbs.description: During Phase 3+, Dragon Orbs appear around the room. Players can click them to summon a blue dragon that shields the raid for 20 seconds. This shield is REQUIRED to survive Darkness of a Thousand Souls.
dragonOrbs.usage: Assign specific players to each orb. When Darkness begins casting, the assigned player clicks their orb immediately.
dragonOrbs.timing: Darkness cast is 8 seconds. Click orb as soon as cast starts.

abilities.name: Soul Flay
abilities.description: Shadow bolt on the tank dealing 4,500-5,500 Shadow damage.
abilities.handling: Keep tank topped off.

abilities.name: Legion Lightning
abilities.description: Chain lightning hitting the target and jumping to nearby players for increasing damage.
abilities.handling: Spread out to limit chain jumps.

abilities.name: Fire Bloom
abilities.description: Fire debuff that deals damage and jumps to a nearby player when it expires or is dispelled.
abilities.handling: Spread out so jumps hit only one person. Affected players move away from others.

abilities.name: Shield Orb
abilities.description: Phase 2+: Orbs that orbit Kil'jaeden, shielding him and shooting Shadow Bolts at the raid.
abilities.handling: Ranged DPS prioritizes killing Shield Orbs quickly. They reduce damage on KJ and add raid damage.

abilities.name: Flame Dart
abilities.description: Phase 2+: Fire damage to random players.
abilities.handling: Heal through it. Unavoidable.

abilities.name: Darkness of a Thousand Souls
abilities.description: Phase 3+: 8-second cast dealing ~50,000 Shadow damage to the entire raid when it completes. Unsurvivable without Dragon Orbs.
abilities.handling: CRITICAL: Assigned player clicks Dragon Orb immediately when cast starts. The dragon's shield absorbs the damage. Without it, everyone dies.

abilities.name: Armageddon
abilities.description: Phase 4: Meteors fall from the sky. Standing in the meteor's shadow when it lands splits the damage. Not standing in it lets it hit full damage to the area.
abilities.handling: Players MUST stand in meteor shadows to soak them. Multiple players per meteor. If no one soaks, massive raid damage. If one person soaks alone, they die.

abilities.name: Sinister Reflection
abilities.description: Phase 4: Creates shadow copies of 4 random players. The reflections have class abilities and attack the raid.
abilities.handling: CC and kill reflections quickly. They use player abilities - healer reflections heal KJ, DPS reflections hurt the raid.

bosses.strategy: PHASE 1-2: Tank and spank. Spread for Fire Bloom and Legion Lightning. Kill Shield Orbs quickly. PHASE 3: DARKNESS IS COMING. Assign players to Dragon Orbs before the fight. When Darkness of a Thousand Souls begins casting, assigned player clicks their orb to spawn the protective dragon. Without this shield, the raid dies. PHASE 4: Pop HEROISM/BLOODLUST. Soak Armageddon meteors with multiple players per shadow. CC and kill Sinister Reflections immediately. Burn Kil'jaeden. This is the culmination of TBC raiding - executing Phase 4 perfectly while burning the boss is the ultimate test.
commonMistakes: Not clicking Dragon Orb during Darkness - raid wipes
Wrong person clicks orb - orb on cooldown for next Darkness
Not enough people soaking Armageddon meteors
Not killing Sinister Reflections - healer copies heal KJ
Not spreading for Fire Bloom - chains through raid
Shield Orbs left alive too long - reduces DPS window
lootHighlights: Thori'dal, the Stars' Fury (Legendary Bow - no ammo needed)
